loans.name: Raeesa

texts.en:
Raeesa is 50 years old from Hebron. She is married and has two children, one of them is at school and the other is continuing his higher education.

She has owned a shop that sells flowers and wedding accessories in their village since May 2012.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more accessories, a stage, and a DJ for her shop. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy more accessories, a stage, and a DJ for her wedding preparations shop

loans.name: Orif

texts.en:
A man, by name Orif, lives in a house which is in bad conditions. He is 50 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and three children. His children’s ages are 25, 23 and 18 years old. He is a higher degree. In 1986 he got a higher degree at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. Since 1986 he has been busy with teaching at the local school. He was a teacher of chemistry till 2006. Since 2006 he is a director of a school. 

His salary is not enough to repair his residential house. His wife is also a teacher and has a small salary. This summer, he wants to repair his house. He is asking for a loan to buy slate, wood, and cement. 

In this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Sulficia

texts.en:
Sulficia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Sulficia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Sulficia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en: Wisam is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a painter when he is not on call for duty in the military. She is currently working in a project which is selling children's and women's clothes and blankets. Now she is requesting a youth loan to add more fashionable women's clothes to open a store and earn better income to help her husband.

loans.use: to add more fashionable women's clothes to her inventory

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 28-year-old married mother of two. She has been working in selling perfumes and accessories for a year and a half to help her husband. He works as a warehouse secretary and has a very low income that is not enough to cover their normal living expenses and their children's needs. The children don't attend school yet.

So Hiba is working hard to develop her business so it is capable of covering future school needs and expenses. She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital with summer perfumes and a new accessories collection. This increase in her business capital will help her widen her working zone and attract new customers, which will increase her income. 

She hopes that one day she will be capable of opening her own accessories and perfume selling shop.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with summer perfumes and an accessories collection

loans.name: Selvin

texts.es: Selvin, tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Hace 4 años que el pudo establecer su propio negocio de barbería, ofrece el servicio de corte de pelo y barba. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y le va muy bien, además vende mercaderia junto con su esposa. Esta solicitando a ODEF un segundo préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar mercadería como ropa y sandalias, para la venta y obtener otros ingresos. Su plan es sacar adelante a su familia y poderles dar un estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Selvin is 36 years old, married, has two children, and lives with his wife in a village of the municipality of Esparta, Atlántida. Fours years ago, he was able to establish his own barber shop where offers haircutting and barber's services. His salon is in his home and is doing very well. He also sells merchandise with his wife. He is requesting a second loan from ODEF of 12,000 lempiras to buy merchandise such as clothing and sandals to sell  and make more earnings. His plan is to support his family and offer an education to his children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell such as clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
MARIA CONCEPCION


MARIA CONCEPCION ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE Y DESDE HACE YA MAS DE 4 AÑOS QUE SE DEDICA  BORDADOS Y TEJIDOS TIPICOS. ESTO LE A AYUDADO A SALIR ADELANTE Y AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. LOS GUIPILES QUE ELLA TEJE SON MUY COMERCIALIZADOS EN EL AREA. Y EL COSTO ES UN POCO ALTO YA QUE EL BORDADO ES MUY ESPECIAL Y LOS DISEÑOS, MOTIVOS Y COLORES SON MUY PRECIOSOS. CONCEPCION HA SIDO RESPONSABLE  EN EL CREDITO YA LLEVA VARIOS AÑOS TRABAJANDO PARA LA FUNDACION, SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE HILOS, TELAS Y MATERIALES PARA TEJER Y BORDAR.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is a native of San Martin Jilopeque and for more than 4 years, she has dedicated her efforts to embroidery and traditional weaving. This has helped her to get ahead and to assist her family with household expenses. 

The indigenous regional dresses and blouses she weaves are very marketable in the area. And the cost is a little higher, since the embroidery is very special and the designs, themes and colors are very precious. 

Maria Concepcion has been responsible with her loans. She has worked with the Foundation for various years, and is currently soliciting a loan to purchase thread, cloth, and materials for her weaving and embroidering.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials for weaving and embroidering.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 35 años, esta casado con Juliana y tiene una casa hecha de madera en donde vive junto a sus 5 hijos.Al tener una familia algo numerosa debe trabajar mucho y por ello decidió mediante la agricultura obtener dinero esperando brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.Tiene una parcela de 2 hectáreas en donde cultiva algunos productos más rentables de su zona como  cacao, café,  y otros.Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que mantiene a sus parcelas en buen estado.Su principal deseo es ampliar su producción comprando terrenos de cultivo para mejorar sus ingresos y poder brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos.Este es el primer préstamo que recibe por parte de KIVA y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su negocio.Desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para comprar con un terreno agrícola de 3 hectáreas para sembrar cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
Esteban is 35 years old, married to Juliana, and has a house made of wood where they live with their 5 children.  Since he has a large family, he has to work a lot and so he decided to earn money through farming since he hopes to provide his family a good quality of life.  He has a 2 hectacre plot of land where he plants crops that are profitable in his area such as cocoa, coffee, and others.  He likes his work very much since he maintains his land in good condition.  His main goal is to expand his production by purchasing farm land to improve his income and provide his children with a good education.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the financial support that he receives to continue with his business.  He will use the 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase a 3 hectacre plot of farm land to plant organic cocoa.

loans.use: to purchase farm land.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Emma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sugar, rice, coffee, etc. 

Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose  Raul

texts.es: Don jose vive junto a su esposa y sus 8  hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; don José necesita invertir en sus cultivos por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc. don jose tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: José lives with his wife and eight children in his own home.  He grows corn and beans.  He has been farming for a number of years and this has given him a lot of experience which allows him to produce the best harvests.  He sells his harvested produce in neighboring areas.  José has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from him because he sells good quality crops at a good price and, above all, he provides good customer service.  He needs to invest in his crops and is requesting this loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, etc.  José has good references from those who know him and is a very responsible man.  He assures lenders that he will be able to repay his loan within the established time period and is also confident that he will be able to provide his household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena. She previously accessed a PHP 30,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to buy additional supplies of fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorena dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old, married, and she supports a family of two. She runs M-PESA (Mobile-money services) and cosmetic sales business in Kapsabet town.This has been her income generating business for the last five years, and she gets an average monthly income of KES. 50,000. 

She has borrowed a loan of KES. 120,000, this being her fourth loan from KADET LTD, and with this loan she intends to purchase different types of cosmetics to stock her business. She anticipates getting profit which she will use to expand her business by increasing the items in her cosmetics shop and also increasing her business float for mobile money services to meet her clients' demand and needs.

Catherine hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business to other towns.

loans.use: To purchase more  cosmetics

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is 26 years old, a married mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jennelyn has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. Jennelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell at her food stall.

Jennelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jennelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es:
MARIA SOFIA
ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE ES DOÑA MARIA SOFIA QUIEN A SUS 46 AÑOS DE EDAD ES PROPIETARIA Y ADMINISTRADORA DE UNA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL COMO LO SON CERDOS Y GANADO VACUNO. DESDE HACE MAS DE CINCO AÑOS POSEE ESTE NEGOCIO EN EL CUAL GRACIAS A DIOS LE HA SERVIDO PARA APRENDER MUCHAS COSAS Y TAMBIEN  PARA EL SUSUTENTO DIARIO DE SU FAMILIA, YA QUE LAMENTABLEMENTE ES VIUDA Y LE HA TOCADO LUCHAR SOLA JUNTO A SUS HIJOS PARA PODER CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES BASICAS, DOÑA SOFIA TIENE BUEN RECORD CREDITICIO YA QUE EN EL CREDITO QUE ESTA POR CANCELAR NO TIENE NI UN DIA DE ATRAZO. DOÑA SOFIA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE CONCENTRADO DE CRECIMIENTO Y ENGORDE PARA CERDOS Y GANADO VACUNO, VITAMINAS, DESPARASITANTES Y TAMBIEN PARA LA COMPRA DE CERDOS PARA LA CRIANZA.
texts.en: Maria Sofia, originally from San Martin Jilotepeque, is 46 years old and is the owner and administrator of a farm, breeding animals like pigs and cattle. More than 5 years ago she started this business in which, thanks to God, has allowed her to learn many things and provide the daily sustenance of the family. She lamentably is a widow and struggles alone to be able to cover her basic the basic needs of herself and her children. Sofia has a good credit record and has never had her credit canceled nor had a single late payment. Sofia is requesting a loan to buy feed for pigs and cattle, vitamins, wormers and also for the purchase of pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed for the animals and pigs to raise

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Don candelario es un hombre  muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 3  hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Don candelario desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Candelario is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always done the best for his children.  Currently he lives together with his wife and their three children.  He is very hardworking and has always done his work with happiness and enthusiasm.  He has worked as a farmer for many years planting the principle basic grains in the area such as corn and beans.  

Candelario wants to increase his sales, so he visited the Integral offices to request a loan which will allow him to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and other items.  He is counting on the requested help since he has no other monetary income and this will ensure that he can provide his household with their daily bread without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a married, the mother of five children and a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and three of her children are in school. Rosalie earns a living by running a transport business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy spare parts for her vehicle. She has been in this business for three years and would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed woman with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

 She operates a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 34 años de edad , está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente vive en una casa hecha con bloques de adobe, el cual compro hace varios años con el fruto de su trabajo.Hace 19 años se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno de 3 hectáreas en donde produce alguno de los productos más rentables de su zona como  cacao, café, maní y otros.Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja todos los días en sus terrenos agrícolas. Posee más plantaciones de cacao porque es un producto que solo requiere mantenerlo limpio de maleza y nutrir los frutos con abono orgánico para así tener un buen resultado.Una vez que cosecha laz mazorcas de cacao los seca y vende a los compradores del lugar , quienes le pagan buenos precios por sus productos.
Uno de sus principales objetivos es mejorar su vivienda construyéndolo con ladrillos y cemento para mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.Este es el primer préstamo que le confían y eso le hace sentir muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan , además se compromete a ser una socia muy puntual en la devolución del dinero.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de cacao para reemplazar los árboles de cacao desfasados ya que no pueden dar más frutos.
texts.en:
Martina is 34 years old, is married, and has two children. At the moment, she lives in an adobe house, which she bought some years ago with the fruits of her hard work. She has made a living in agriculture for over 19 years, on a 19 hectare plot of land on which she grows some of the profitable products such as cocoa, coffee, peanuts, and other items. She is supported by her husband, who works every day on their agricultural land. She has more cocoa plantations because it is a product which only needs to be kept weed-free and its pods fed with organic compost to get a good result. Once she has harvested the cocoa beans, she dries them and sells them to local buyers, who pay good prices for her produce.

One of her main aims is to improve her home by building it with bricks and cement, in order to improve her family's quality of life. This is her first loan, and it makes her feel very grateful for the opportunity given to her. She also promises to be a very punctual member in repaying the money. With the 3,000 soles she will buy cocoa plants to replace the old cocoa trees, because they no longer bear fruit.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 26 years old and is from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2012. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and install display shelves in his grocery store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and install display shelves in his grocery store.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej was born in 1991. She is married and has an infant. She is studying Accounting at Al-Mafraq College. Her husband is a police officer and his income is barely enough to cover her semester fees. As a result, she is requesting a loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana lives in the village of Zovaber, which is in the Sevan area. She is engaged on her own in farming and agriculture. She has two cows, one heifer, one pig, six sheep, four lambs and six chickens. She also cultivates some greens and potatoes on her own plot of land. Svetlana does all this by herself, since her husband works abroad in the Russian Federation. She lives with her retired mother-in -law, her son who sometimes helps Svetlana around the farm, and her daughter who recently got married and lives separately with her own family. Svetlana has never been employed anywhere and, since getting married, she has been engaged in farming. Svetlana has plans to build a barn for her cattle, and she also wants to buy a lot of fodder for the farm animals. She needs 1,000,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to start her building activities. This is Svetlana’s first deal with Kiva, and she very much hopes that her expectations will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to build a new barn for her cattle and  to buy a lot of fodder for the animals.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 32 years old, married, and supports three people. She runs a furniture-making business in the town of Kapsabet. This has been her income-generating business for the last 14 years. She receives an average monthly income of KES 79,166. She has borrowed a loan of KES 80,000, which is her third loan from KADET LTD. With this loan, she intends to purchase timber, nails and various types of materials for making furniture. She anticipates making profits, which she will use to expand her business by increasing the number of models of furniture, to meet client demand. Sarah hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable, and to be able to pay school fees for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and other materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling recyclable materials in the Philippines. Erlinda applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more recyclable materials to sell. Erlinda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is married and has been blessed with children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He cites food and school fees as his major challenges.

Karisa has operated a goat meat-selling business in which he sells retail to his neighbors and town-dwellers. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to his place of operation. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase seven goats to sell. Karisa decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Delmy

texts.es: Rosa es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz, sus productos son de muy buena calidad los comercializa en  los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Rosa solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very friendly, hard-working lady who lives with her husband and five children.  Rosa works very hard on her own plot of land where she grows corn.  Her produce is very good quality and she sells it in the different markets near her home.  

Rosa is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL as she needs to invest in buying farm supplies such as pesticides, fertilizers, compost, seeds and other products she needs for her crops.  She hopes to increase her sales so that she can make more profits and provide her family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Daniel Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, empezó a trabajar con su tía como ayudante en el negocio de venta de ropa y luego de algunos años de adquirir experiencia emprende su propio negocio,  se decidió a realizar un préstamo en Banco D-MIRO porque desea a mediano plazo tener su propio local comercial en el centro de la ciudad, para ofertar ropa de damas y caballeros.
texts.en: Daniel lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. He began working with his aunt as a helper in the clothing store, and after some years of acquiring experience, he is launching his own business. He made the decision to undertake a loan with Banco D-MIRO, because he wishes in the medium term to have his own shop in the center of the city, in order to offer women's and men's clothing.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es: Doña Maria de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos,  ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 14 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, doña Maria quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 68 years old and lives in her own house with her two children.  She owns a store where she sells necessity items such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items.  She has had the business for 14 years and this has given her the sales experience that allows her to earn more profits.  The store is located in her home in town and is recognized by her neighbors in the area.  She has many customers since she always has the store well stocked.

Maria wants to expand the store and make a new investment but she needs capital, so she is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary items for the store.  She is sure that she will repay her debt and hopes that this will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase milk, eggs, basic grains, oil, snacks, soft drinks, water, soda, and other items.

loans.name: Francia Maribel

texts.es: Doña francia vive con su hija en casa alquilada ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la  mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, francia es una mujer dedicada a su labor  y con muchas metas por delante, su más grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito, es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. francia  tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francia lives with her daughter in a rented home. She has a store where she sells basic goods, beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among other things. She has had this business for many years and this has given her a lot of sales experience, which has allowed her to get more profits. The store is in her home, in a well-trafficked area. She has gained many customers, because she has the best-stocked store. People prefer her and keep her ahead of the competition because she always has what they need, with quality products at affordable prices, and with unequaled service, always what the customer wants. Francia is a woman who is dedicated to her work and she has a lot of goals ahead of her. Her greatest secret to achieve success is perseverance and love of her work. She knows that this is the only way to achieve what she wants. Like all good business owners, she wants to grow her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. This is why she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy basic grains, candies, eggs, bread, drinks, etc. Francia has good payment references. She is sure that she will pay off the loan and also believes that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Hydie

texts.en: Hydie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Hydie applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Hydie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jeanlyn

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Jeanlyn works hard to support her family. She has a laundry business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from clothing sales. Jeanlyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase soap and other supplies for her laundry business. Jeanlyn has been maintaining her business activities with her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soap and other supplies for her laundry business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a 50-year-old mother from Shienwe, in Kakamega county, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Omari, who is a businessman, and she is the mother of three children, who are 24, 21 and 10 years old, respectively. She has a stall where she sells cereals. She has been doing this for the last seven years, and she can comfortably make a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for her fifth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more maize, beans and millet. She will plow the anticipated profits back into the business. Her dream is to become a supplier, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, such as maize, beans and millet, to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy fertilizers and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Miguela hopes that she will continue to be successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en: Ritchel is 39 years old and the married mother of three. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ritchel has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. Ritchel applied for a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF, in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle. Ritchel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money to provide financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the tricycle she uses in her transportation business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
With the earnings from his business, Jackson and his wife pay their household expenses.

Jackson is requesting this loan in order to buy fruit, vegetables, meat and other supplies to keep his grocery store stocked so that he can keep providing his customers with items they need.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat and other supplies to keep his grocery store stocked.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan was born in 1993. She has five siblings, and one of her brothers is in the military. She is studying History at Al Albait University and aspires to continue her studies. Now she seeks a loan to pay her semester fees to be able to work after that and help her brother in getting better income for her family.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 26 year old married man from Nablus city. He is a father with three sons, all of whom are in school. For the past few years, Ihab has been working in a sewing workshop he owns. He would like to improve his products by buying a new sewing machine. This will provide him with a higher income. 
Ihab requested a 1,500 United States dollar (USD) loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Ihab to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop. This will increase his income and develop the standard of living for his family. 
Ihab appears in the Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen has earned a living for the last 10 years by making furniture. He mainly makes wooden doors and different types of furniture for customers who place orders with him. He rents his work location and lives with his family in Vanadzor city. His wife works as a nurse at Vanadzor State Medical College and his son is in the military. Armen considers his business very profitable, but needs more supplies and wants to have some furniture on hand to show to his customers. He is requesting a loan for 500.000 Armenian drams to buy raw materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is widowed, with five children. Four of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (children of her late brother). 

Jane has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Jane works at the market four days a week and she sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and fire. 

She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis and also to build her own business premises. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yolanda de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hija de 15 años de edad en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene  mucha clientela pues la buscan porque sus productos son frescos y a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, doña Yolanda esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas frutas y verduras por mayor y seguir con su negocio y poder darle a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Yolanda, 47, is a single mother. She lives with her 15-year-old daughter in her own home. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the market that is close to where she lives. She has a lot of customers. They seek her out because her products are fresh and sold at good prices. With her earnings, she is able to cover her household expenses. Yolanda is applying for a loan to be able to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables, continue with her business, and be able to give her daughter what she needs with no restrictions.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sami

texts.ru: Сами истинный фермер и житель города Канибадам Согдийской области Таджикистана. Он позитивный и коммуникабельный человек, а когда работает он свое свое внимание посвящает работе. Сами женат и отец двоих детей. Ему 51 год. Его жена и сын находятся на заработках за переделами страны, а дочь учится в школе. Сами является главой дехканского хозйства. Он на большом участке земли выращивает арбуз, дыню, пшеницу, ячмень, морковь и корм скота. Сами занимается земледельческой деятельностью на протяжении 12 лет и за эти годы приобрел достаточный опыт. Сейчас он запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить качественный урожай. У Сами большие планы на будущее. Его главная цель - в будущем построить теплицу.
texts.en: Sami is a genuine farmer and a resident of the Konibodom city in the Sughd region of Tajikistan.  He is a positive and personable person, who devotes all of his attention to work when he works.  Sami is married and a father of two children.  He is 51 years old.  His wife and son are working abroad, and daughter goes to school.  Sami is a head of a dekhan farm.  He grows watermelon, cantaloupe, wheat, carrots and livestock feed on a large land plot.  Sami has been involved in a farming business for 12 years and acquired plentiful experience during these years.  Now he is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to get a quality harvest.  Sami has big plans for the future.  His main goal is to build a greenhouse in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to get a quality harvest

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for ten years. 

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works from her home and sells on a retail basis, seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. She resides in her own house and her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Subhashree M M Group

texts.en:
The group Subhashree M M has 10 members who are all from the same neighbourhood. The lady standing in the middle wearing a red saree in the photo is Shundari, the leader of the group. Shundari is a 51-year-old married woman in Balipatna village of Odisha, India. The couple has one child who is doing a part-time job in a private company. Shundari lives with her son and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. For past 13 years she is involved in the activity of growing and selling vegetables; her husband and her son help her in this activity. 

All other members of this group are engaged other different kind of activities like agriculture, cattle farming etc. In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Shundari, together with her group Subhashree M M, has requested a loan amount of 200,000 INR for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable farming

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1991, and he has two sisters. He is studying Computer Science at the The University of Science and Technology. Mohammad also works at an aluminum shop, which is not giving him a high enough income to cover his family's needs and his study fees. Now he is requesting a loan that can help him to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: to pay his study fees.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is a 30-year-old married woman with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a mini supermarket. The income from her business has enabled her to educate her children and buy a plot of land. Her dream is to buy another plot of land and build a home; although, price fluctuation is a challenge. Norah will use the loan to add inventory for her business like sugar, bread, soap, and rice.

loans.use: to add inventory like sugar, bread, soap and rice

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en: Mkhitar is a qualified builder, but he has never worked in that trade, since he has been engaged in farming and agriculture since he was very young. He manages to do a perfect job of taking care of his farm animals: a cow, eight sheep, six lambs, and twenty chickens. A plot of land that Mkhitar has will bring some income to his family in the near future, since Mkhitar plans to start potato cultivation. Mkhitar is 45 years old. He lives in the village of Zovaber, which is in the Gegharkunik area, with his wife, three children and his retired mother. His wife works at the local school as a teacher of the Russian language, their elder son is a student, and their other two children are still school-aged. Mkhitar applied for a loan of 200,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to buy a large lot of potato seedlings, in order to start potato production. He thanks all Kiva lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of potato seedlings, in order to start producing potatoes on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for maintenance on the tricycle units (motorcycle and sidecar) units used in his transportation business.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en: Because Ameena is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Ameena was born in 1974. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a distributor. She works with her husband selling tissues and in recycling tissues and envelopes, and she is applying for a loan to increase the quantities of tissue boxes she buys, in order to supply nearby markets and to expand her business, which will help her husband to earn a better income to covers their children’s needs.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of boxes of tissues she buys to supply nearby markets.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a young businessman, who has already found a field from which he has a good income. He produces furniture, mainly coffee tables, chairs and wooden doors. He works in small room in his house, which serves as a workshop for him.  He buys all of the materials for furniture production from a local shop of construction materials, but he buys wood from individuals. Arman sells ready furniture to local furniture shops. Arman also works on a by-order basis.

Arman lives with his wife and newborn son in the small city of Vanadzor, which is in the region of Lori. Arman asks for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to buy raw materials, specifically, wood and laminate for his work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood and laminate

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling used bed sheets, and is applying for a loan for 1,800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more of these sheets to sell to her customers. She generates additional income by selling soft drinks, works five days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and build rooms to rent out. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medicines.

loans.use: to buy more used bed sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La  Sra. Marcela tiene 37 años, tiene tres  hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres de pollera, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Puerto Camacho, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Marcela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta ya que hace mucho frio, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la  Sra. Marcela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus chompas.
texts.en: Marcela is 37 years old and has three school-aged children.  She knits alpaca sweaters and blankets for women and has a workshop in her home, located in the Puerto Camacho zone.  This will be her first loan through the institution and Marcela will use it to buy alpaca yarn in quantity so she can knit her sweaters and blankets.  She makes many sales now that it has gotten cold.  She also delivers her products to the different markets in El Alto.  She is asking for this loan so she can increase her working capital.  Marcela has challenges in her business, such as assorting her merchandise and she will use the benefits to continue buying her sweater knitting supplies in bulk.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Azzam

texts.en: Azzam was born in 1970. He is married and has five children. He lives at his own house and owns a washer repair shop. Azzam doesn’t earn enough income to allow him to import spare parts for the washers from the source. Now he is requesting a loan to import the spare parts that he needs and to expand his shop so that he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to import the spare parts that he needs for his business

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en: Karlen is a young farmer who is already highly skilled in animal breeding and land cultivation. He has four cows, four calves, twenty sheep and thirty chickens. He also cultivates potatoes, grains and tomatoes. He and his family live in the village of Geghamavan, where his parents help him with his work. Karlen has already taken out a loan from Kiva lenders and used it to repair his cattle barn and buy two calves. He is very grateful and touched by such kind support and is eager to continue working with Kiva lenders. This time he is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 Armenian drams to enlarge his herd and to stock up on animal fodder for the coming winter months.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder, calves and bulls.

loans.name: Safiyya

texts.en:
Safiyya is 52 years old and comes from Nablus. She is married and has three children. She has owned a grocery store since 2012. She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more goods and food, mobile cards, and some needed decorations for the store.

She hopes that this loan will increase their sales and thus improve the income of the family to provide the children with a better education. The one who appears in the picture is Safiyya's husband since she refused to appear in a picture due to cultural manners.

loans.use: to buy more goods and food, mobile cards, and some needed decorations

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
This is Cerila, 53, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Cerila operates a vegetable farm. She grows vegetables and some sweet potato in their farm located in Cavite, in the highlands where it is suited to growing vegetables and fruit. She sells her product at the market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Cerila dreams of being able to give all her family a good life and hopes to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Blessed Utete Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 55 year old Jerryfanos from Masvingo. He is married, and has three children. Jerryfanos runs a manufacturing business producing mealie meal (coarse corn flour). The business has been in operation for eight years. He says the main challenge being faced is stiff competition from other players resulting in reduction of prices. 
Jerryfanos has requested a loan of $600 United States dollars (USD) to purchase maize to produce mealie meal. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase his income and hence improve his family's welfare. In the future, Jerryfanos plans to build his mealie meal producing plant and later venture into a transport business.

loans.use: to purchase maize to produce mealie meal.

loans.name: Jofesi

texts.en: Jofesi is a 44-year-old married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He has worked as a teacher for 21 years and is on the job ten hours a day. In his free time, he farms some land to supplement his income. In his work, he is inspired by the fact that he likes young children and wants to contribute to their development. Because the low salary that he earns hardly meets his needs, he now intends to start up a retail shop. Jofesi is requesting a loan to buy sugar and rice to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 60 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the cloth business for eight years and also runs a retail business for general merchandise as an additional income source. The seasonal nature of his business is his major challenge. 

Gideon is requesting a loan, which he will use to pay school fees for children. He hopes that all his children complete university.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en: Wesam is a 21-year-old single guy, the brother of five siblings. To help his family and support himself, Wesam takes over some painting jobs. His ambition to get a Bachelor's degree led him to register at the university and start majoring in Banking and Finance. Now Wesam is applying for an educational loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has her own business which she worked hard to set up. She has a well-stocked grocery store in which she works from very early in the morning. 

Fatuma is requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies for her store such as drinks, vegetables, fruit and other basic products so that she can continue giving her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store such as drinks, vegetables, fruit and other basic products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has two children who attend school. She sells used clothes and generates additional income through selling used shoes.  She works at the market and sells on a retail basis seven days a week.

Christine is requesting a loan from MCDT-SACCO for 1,700,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She aspires to import used clothes and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expense includes rent, electricity bills, and food.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Marta Lizeth

texts.es: marta vive en casa alquilada con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, desodorantes, shampoo, etc. en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, marta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y seguir con su negocio y ayudar en su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Marta lives in a rented home with her husband and their two children. She works selling fragrances, deodorant, shampoo, etc. from her home. She has been doing this for several years and has a large customer base because her products are very good quality and her prices are really affordable. She uses the profit she makes to help out with household expenses. Marta is requesting a loan so that she can buy more wholesale merchandise, keep her business going, and help out at home without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fragrances, deodorant, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
This is Isidora, 53, resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Roberto and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Isidora oversees and owns operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she improves her business.  

Isidora dreams that her business will continue. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married, with five children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her old parents. 

She has a business of market-vending and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 900,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more fruits, like mangoes, carrots, tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, watermelon, and paw paws.  

Harriet works at the market five days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of fruits from the villages to her stall. She aspires to grow some of those fruits and also to start selling on a wholesale basis only.  

Harriet resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and utilities.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell, like mangoes, carrots, tomatoes, oranges, watermelon, paw paws, and pineapples.

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Andrea, habita en el barrio revolución, es madre de tres hijos 2 menores de edad que estudian y el mayor ya trabaja como pintor, su esposo se gana la vida trabajando de conductor y Andrea continua siempre con las ventas de comida, de esta manera se conforma la familia de doña Andrea, ella lucha para brindarles lo mejor  dentro de sus posibilidades; es por eso que solicita el crédito para hacer divisiones de cocina y poner cerámica en el piso, así poco a poco irá cumpliendo su sueño de mejorar su casa, para poder vivir en mejores condiciones junto a su familia.
texts.en: Andrea lives in the Revolution neighborhood and is the mother of three dependent children, two of whom are students, while the oldest is a painter. Her husband works as a driver, and Andrea continues to sell food to help support her family. Andrea strives to offer her family the best she can; therefore, she has applied for a loan to put up dividers in the kitchen and to tile the floor so that she can slowly realize her dream of remodeling her house and living with her family in better circumstances.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, and tiles.

loans.name: Yeranush

texts.en:
Yeranush is an owner of small farm; she has a cow, three bulls and fourteen sheep. She also has a plot of land where she cultivates different vegetables. Yeranush lives in Zovaber village in the Gegharkunik area. She lives with her husband, who is disabled. They have a son who works as a builder and a daughter; she works at the local school as a cook.

Yeranush manages the farming and agriculture alone but sometimes her son helps her. Now Yeranush plans to begin larger-scale potato production and she asks for a Kiva loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to start it. She has taken loans from Nor Horizon already three times and she is a very reliable person.

loans.use: To begin larger-scale potato production

loans.name: Yvrose

texts.en: Yvrose has already taken out three loans to launch her clean energy retail business. She is selling her EarthSpark clean energy products on a resale basis in her community. After selling out the entire inventory she bought with her last loan and still has customers calling her with more orders. She is taking out a fourth loan to help meet the demand in her community for a source of renewable energy that will allow customers save money while helping the environment.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Zulpin

texts.ru: Зулпин жительница Яванского района. Ей 53 года. Она замужем и имеет двоих сыновей в возрасте 27 и 10 лет, двоих дочерей в возрасте 25 и 21 года. Уже более 6 лет как она со всей своей семьей занимается животноводством. Зулпин закупает, откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Прибыль, получаемый с деятельности является их главным источником дохода и тратится на семейные нужды. Кроме того Зулпин сама является ветеринаром. Сейчас Зулпин запрашивает кредит для закупа бычков с целью их дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zulpin is a resident of Yavan, Tajikistan.  She is 53 years old, married and has two sons, aged 27 and 10, and two daughters, aged 25 and 21.  For more than six years, she and her family have worked with livestock.  Zulpin buys, fattens and resells cows.  The profits from this business is the most important source of income the family has for their needs.  Zulpin is also a veterinarian.  Now, she is asking for a loan to buy bulls to fatten and sell.  She relies on your support.

loans.use: To purchase cows to resell

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan, age 46, is a married woman. She deals in a business of milk sales to provide financial support to her husband, in meeting their household expenses efficiently. She is a mother of four. She is very motivated to provide her children with beautiful lives, with good education, food, and clothing.  

Rasheedan has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. 

To get an increase in the production capacity of milk, she needs to purchase another buffalo. For this reason, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation. The loan will help her to inflate her sales which, ultimately, will help in generating more cash. 

Rasheedan is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Don mario de 62 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, sus dos hijos, su nuera y sus dos nietos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, don mario es un hombre dedicado a su labor, luchador siempre dispuesto a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero no posee de suficiente  capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. don mario tiene buenas referencias de pago y está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Mario, who is 62 years old, lives with his life partner, their two children, a daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and sorghum. He has been a farmer for many years, and has gained very valuable experience that allows him to obtain the best crops. His land is located in a highly agricultural area. He sells his products all over the surrounding areas and has a lot of regular customers. These people always prefer his products, because of their quality and because his prices are really affordable. The service is also unbeatable. 

Mario is very dedicated to his work. He is a fighter, and he is always willing to work hard in order to succeed. His business is booming, and he wants to make the most of this by increasing production so that he can obtain higher profits. He needs to invest in supplies, but doesn't have enough capital. That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral, which will allow him to purchase corn seed, sorghum, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. 

Mario has good credit references, and he is certain that he will be able to pay off his debt on time. He is also confident that he will be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, sorghum, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Don pablo de 61 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa, don pablo esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su esposa.
texts.en: Pablo, 61, has been farming for some years, which has given him the training and knowledge to take care of his crops. His main crops are corn and maicillo. He sells his merchandise to basic grain dealers close to his home, and he is able to pay household expenses with his profits. He lives in his own house with his wife. Pablo has applied for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, seed, and fertilizer to increase profits and to have financial stability for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Clean and Prune 400 cacao trees

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло работает и живет в городе Нурек в 70 км к юго-востоку от столицы страны. Ей 41 год. Она замужем и у нее четверо детей. Шахло сама зарабатывает на жизнь и обеспечивает семью. Она занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Шахло в собственном магазине продает продукты питания, хозяйственные товары и домашнюю одежду. У Шахло большой опыт в этой сфере обслуживания. Ее умение обращаться с клиентами помогли ей продвигать бизнес более 15-и лет и улучшить условия проживания семьи. Шахло очень любит свой бизнес и намерена и дальше развивать его. Она нуждается в кредите, чтобы приобрести ассортимент продуктов питания. Данный кредит поможет ей увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Shahlo works and lives in the city Nurek, 70 kilometers southeast of Dushanbe, Tajikistan's capitol.  She is 41 years old, married and has four children.  Shahlo earns a living and provides for her family.  She is a seller at a market in the center of the city.  In her own store, she sells food items, household items and home wear.  Shahlo has extensive experience in this business.  Her ability to handle clients has helped her develop this business for more than 15 years, improving the lives of her family.  Shahlo really loves her business and is determined to grow it further.  She needs a loan to buy an assortment of food items.  This loan will help increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of food items to expand her business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, age 58, is a certified organic farmer in the beautiful village of San Pedro Columbia. Thomas together with his wife Maria raised nine children, one still living at home. His wife Maria spends most of her time at home. Maria enjoys harvesting cacao with her husband. 

Thomas’ decision to grow cacao was his own idea and initiative, he got seedlings from his neighbors and started to plant cacao. The cacao drink, being a drink of the Gods, Thomas decided to follow his ancestor’s love of the cacao drink and plant cacao. Thomas also cultivates a variety of farm crops such as corn, beans, mango, avocado etc… he enjoys farming and especially now that he sees the financial benefits from cacao production. Thomas stated that his farm requires cleaning so that it can be ready for the next upcoming crop season. He faces a challenge with pest and disease such as monillia and blockpod. 

Thomas is requesting this loan to pay helpers to assist him in general cleaning and pruning of trees affected by the monilia fungus. 

His future goals are to focus on farm management and increase his financial income. Thomas and his wife live happily on the farm and will later transfer the farm to his children when he sees the need.

loans.use: To clean 500 cacao trees

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio age 56, is an organic certified cacao farmer of MMC, who lives in the beautiful village of Pueblo Viejo, Toledo District. The village is situated along the newly constructed highway that will connect Belize to Guatemala. Herminio and his wife Margarita raised eleven children of which four are living at home and the others currently enrolled in school. 

Herminio got inspired to plant cacao from the assistance given by a local association. He now manages 700 productive cacao trees. Herminio stated that he didn’t have any intention of selling his cacao beans due to the difficult fermentation process. Herminio is now happily managing his cacao farm due to the fact that MMC is now buying freshly harvested cacao. Hermino says he loves farming cacao due to the financial benefits that it brings to his family’s daily lives. He also cultivates a variety of farm crops such as beans, corn etc.

Herminio is requesting this loan to in order to pay helpers to assist him in cleaning. He presently manages his grocery store so Herminio has limited time to clean his cacao farm.

Presently Herminio’s children are being educated or employed away from the farm.
Herminio’s future goal is to retire from the farm, hopefully his children will later expand the farm and he would like at least one of them to become a farmer.

loans.use: To clean 700 cacao trees

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза молодая женщина в возрасте 38 лет. Замужем и имеет троих детей. После окончании школы не смогла поступить в университет так в семье были финансовые трудности. Но у Фирузы с самого детства была любовь к шитью. Ей очень нравилась наблюдать как ее бабушка шьет национальные платья. И когда Фируза повзрослела бабушка подарила ей свою машинку. Постепенно Фируза научилась шить национальные платье. Теперь она профессиональная швея. У нее очень много клиентов. Этим сейчас Фируза зарабатывает себе на жизнь.
Швейная машинка у Фирузы совсем устарела и очень часто ломается, поэтому она хочет купить новую швейную  машинку.  Но чтобы купить машинку ей не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому Фируза решила обратиться в организацию Арванд за кредитом. Она очень надеется что ей в Арванде помогут и финансово поддержат.
texts.en: Firuza is a young 38 year-old woman.  She is married and has three children.  She was not able to get into a university after completing school due to financial difficulties.  But Firuza has had a love for sewing since childhood.  She liked very much to observe how her grandmother sewed national dresses.  And when Firuza grew up, her grandmother gave her her sewing machine.  Gradually, Firuza learned how to sew national dresses.  Now she is a professional seamstress.  She has a lot of clients.  This is how Firuza earns her living now.  Firuza's sewing machine has gotten old and often breaks down.  This is why she wants to buy a new sewing machine, but she does not have enough money to buy one.  Hence, Firuza decided to come to the Arvand organization for a loan.  She hopes very much that Arvand will help her and offer financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Dúo Margaritas Group

texts.es:
dúo margaritas
Este dúo esta conformado por doña María Transita ella tiene 63 años y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y por las tardes venta de refacción en su casa, ubicada en San Bartolomé Milpas Altas, ella es una mujer viuda muy trabajadora y se quedo a cargo de una hija que gracias a Dios poco a poco la a ayudado y la ha sacado adelante su deseo es seguir apoyándola ya ella es la unica hija, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su negocio en compra de mercaderia en verduras y frutas y poder surtirlo mas y ofrecerles sus verduras y frutas frescas a sus clientes, y poder lograr su propósito mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y de su hija, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
María Transita, 63, belongs to the communal bank Dúo Margaritas. She sells fruits and vegetables and, in the afternoon, sells spare parts in her house in San Bartolomé Milpas Altas. She is a very hardworking widow who cares for her daughter. Thanks to God, María has been able to help her get ahead. María hopes to continue doing so, as this is her only daughter.

María has applied for a loan to invest in her business by buying fruits and vegetables so that she has more fresh inventory to offer her customers and so that she can achieve her goal of raising the standard of living for herself and her daughter. She hopes the lenders will help her through this loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Doña Ana de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad, ella tiene un pequeño  negocio ubicado en las afueras del  parque recreativo que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia vende  refrescos, golosinas, dulce, fruta, etc. a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Doña ana  busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas productos por mayor para surtir mas su negocio y lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Ana, 55, lives in her own house with her husband and 17-year-old son. She has a small business, located outside the recreational park near her home, where she sells beverages, sweets, candy, fruits, and more. The business helps support her family. Ana is trying to improve the quality of her life. She has applied for a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise to stock her business, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wholesale beverages, sweets, candy, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine is a 19-year-old, married woman, who has been working as a tailor for three years. She was only sixteen years old when she started working in this domain because she had to quit her secondary school in order to help in her family's living. 

Sabrine is a hard worker. She developed her skills quickly, then she started her own business in July 2012. Today, Sabrine sells ready-made clothes and, at the same time, she repairs customers' clothes and tailors clothes they desire to have.

Sabrine is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a special summer clothes collection to support her ready-made clothes business in order to widen it and attract new customers.

She hopes to keep on developing her socio-economic life, to make sure she's going to have a safe future with her beloved husband.

loans.use: to buy a special summer clothes collection for her business.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
Bishnupriya is a 39-year-old lady. She is staying in Odisha with her husband and her three children, who are in schooling. Her husband is a farmer. For the past twelve years, she has been engaged in the activity of selling cow milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity.

Bishnupriya is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Maa Mangala Self Help Group (SHG). There are ten members in the group, and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kind of activities like agriculture, and some have grocery shops.

She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 1,900,000 INR to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. Bishnupriya has a dream to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 42-year-old, married woman, with five children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in a soda depot and, with the proceeds, she has educated her children. She hopes to have a wholesale depot, despite the challenge of lack of sufficient capital.

Irene is requesting a loan to buy more crates of soda, beer, and boxes of water to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, beer, and boxes of water to sell.

loans.name: Juliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juliana es una mujer de 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Juliana no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta apoyar a su mamá en los que aceres del hogar y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Parrillada para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juliana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella ocupa un pequeño espacio en su vivienda donde vende cosméticos, cremas, perfumes y otros, Juliana trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás. 
Juliana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la remodelación del espacio que ocupa para sus ventas, ella desea tarrajear y pintar las paredes, adicionalmente comprará una vitrina para exhibir mejor sus productos, así pues Juliana seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Juliana is 23 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings.  She is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve herself.  Unfortunately, owing to a lack of financial resources and the need to work in order to help her parents, Juliana was unable to study for a degree in accountancy as she would have liked to.  In her free time, she likes supporting her mom with the housework and she sometimes cooks a delicious barbecue to share with her family.

Using her own initiative, Juliana works with determination and dedication in her own small business selling beauty products.  She has a small space in her home where she sells cosmetics, creams, perfumes and other products.  She works every day for approximately 8 hours.  She feels happy in her work and believes that she is doing well because of the good prices she charges and the kind way she treats others. 

Juliana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to re-model her sales space.  She would like to plaster and paint the walls.  She would also like to buy a display case so that she can better display her products.  Juliana will continue working hard to realize her biggest dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to re-model her sales space and to buy a display case

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a thirty-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Enid has been in the cosmetics business for eleven years, but she also trades in the coffee business and basket-weaving to earn additional income. She started the business to educate her children and improve on her standard of living.
