Enid intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Parfait

texts.fr: Parfait est une homme de 39 ans fiancé père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 et 12 ans.  L'un d'eux va encore à l'école. Il est commerçant et vend du poisson frais dans un marché de la capitale depuis 4 ans. c'est grâce à ça qu'ils'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter le poisson détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de poisson, Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Parfait, age 39, is engaged to be married. He has three children aged 1 to 12, one of whom goes to school. 

He has been selling fresh fish at a market of the capital for the past four years, which is how he supports his family. Since buying his stock at retail is not very profitable, this loan is very important to Parfait’s activity as it will enable him to increase his stock of fish. This will eliminate the need for daily trips, cut down on his taxi expenses, and bolster his profits.

He plans to reinvest part of his profits in his activity, and to use the remainder to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to bolster his stock of fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 29-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of paranda-making for many years. Paranda is considered a traditional hair accessory, especially in rural areas of Pakistan. Pakistani women use them for a traditional look on special occasions, like eids and weddings. 

Balqees makes parandas of different styles, especially for bridal hairstyles. She is striving hard to meet her family's expenditures. She is a mother of three children and is responsible for providing them with a good environment, with good food, clothing, and education. 

Balqees applied a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy raw materials, such as colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls, for embellishment. This would help in attracting more customers. She desires to utilize part of the revenue to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls, for embellishment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con sus abuelos y su prima viven en casa propia, Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos del hogar. La clienta  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda con granos básicos, aceite, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, azúcar, café, etc. de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: The client lives in her own house with her grandparents; her cousin lives in her own house. The client runs a business in her house: a shop where she sells food items such as bread, beverages, oil, vegetables, fruits, sweets and household items like soap and shampoo. Her business income helps her pay household expenses. The client has applied for a loan to stock more inventory of basic grains, oil, eggs, sweets, beverages, sugar, coffee, and more so that she can better serve her customers and also increase sales, which is a priority, as she wants to continue to help with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, eggs, sweets, beverages, sugar, coffee, and more.

loans.name: Juan Obilio

texts.es: Don juan vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador, don juan está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía, ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Juan lives in his own house with his wife and two children and works as a farmer. For several years he has been planting beans and corn and by selling his harvest he has been able to cover his living costs. He is a responsible, honest and hard-working man. Juan is seeking a loan in order to be able to buy supplies for his crops such as fertilizer, manure, and seeds, as shown in the photograph, since he cannot afford these expenses with what he earns. In this way he will have a better income and better economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Bafrin

texts.en:
Bafrin is a 31-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Bafrin is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home. She is using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Bafrin has five years experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. She makes dresses for women and children, as well as small household fabric items. She currently uses a simple sewing machine and feels limited in her creativity and the options she can offer her customers. She would like to buy an over-lock machine to be able to work with more complicated fabrics, as well as an ironing board and good quality fabrics and raw materials. To be able to make these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an over-lock machine and materials.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 51-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. 

For the past 25 years, Shameem has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a cow in milk to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner, at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now, she has three cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

Shameem has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase a buffalo. She is in her seventh loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Yostus

texts.en:
Yostus is a fifty-year-old married man with twelve children. 

He has been in the hardware business for ten years, plus does farming as an additional income source. His hardware business is located on a busy street.

He began the business to sustain his family, and wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with eight children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister-in-law).   

Gertrude has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 1 ½ years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and beans. She works seven days out of every week in a shop and sells on a retail basis only. She generates additional income from rental rooms.  

Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation. 

Gertrude resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and beans.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benkan  sont toutes mariées  dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Nerekoro dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de riz (riz gambiaka, riz de 2ème choix,) des échalotes, etc.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (1ème femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche  sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du riz  de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500kg de riz. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes. Madame Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera investi dans l’activité et assurer les frais de scolarité des enfants. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Awa a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activités dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Benkan are married women who live in polygamous families. They average 47 years of age and three children each. They live in the village of Nerekoro, in the region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors and through ties of marriage and kinship. They work in small trade, selling rice (gambiaka, 2nd grade), green onions, etc.

To bolster their working capital, the group members turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and this is their 7th group loan cycle. Mrs. Awa (first on the right in the photo) enjoys a great reputation as a seller of a wide variety of rice. She will use her loan to buy 500 kg of rice. She conducts her sales from her home, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of both men and women. 

Mrs. Awa expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which she will use to invest in her activity and to cover her children’s tuition fees. Like the other group members, she hopes that their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso will help to bolster her activity.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married, and he supports a family of seven people. 

He runs a furniture-making business in Kapsabet town, in Nandi County. This has been his income-generating business for the last 13 years. From this business, he gets an average monthly profit of KES 6,000. 

James has borrowed a loan of KES 80,000, this being his fifth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). With this loan, he intends to purchase timber, block-board, triply, nails, and different types of materials for making furniture. He anticipates getting profits which he will use to expand his business by increasing the number of models of furniture, to meet his clients' demands. 

James' dream is to expand his business to a big and regional furniture-making company.

loans.use: to purchase timber, block-board, triply, nails, and different types of materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and five children. She has been running a business of  sewing uppers for shoes for many years. She stitches the uppers of shoes and then supplies the different factories where these are used in making shoes.  She wants to grow her business.  She applied for a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy a new sewing machine and leather for making shoe uppers. She is very experienced in her field and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to fulfill the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and leather.

loans.name: Rasheed

texts.en: Rasheed is 54 years old.  She is a married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Rasheed makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Rasheed wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en: Ammar is 21 years old, single and has three siblings. Ammar is a third-year university student majoring in civil engineering. Now Ammar is seeking an educational loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Naomy

texts.en:
Naomy is a 22-year-old woman, from Kakamega town which is located within the western part of Kenya. She is married to Lenson, who is a businessman. She supports three people in her family.

Naomy has a retail shop that has been operating for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 25,000. She is taking her first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which she will use to purchase items to sell, like sugar, salt, cooking oil, and bar soap. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

Naomy's dream is to make the business successful, so as to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase the stocks of sugar, salt, cooking oil, and bar soap to sell.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah is a 46 year-old woman.  She is a widow who started making accessories.  She sells them to make a living and support her family.  Kefah is applying for a loan to bring more beads for making accessories to increase her profits.

loans.use: to bring more beads for making more accessories

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 19 years old and single. She has been involved in the business of milk sales for about three years. She initiated her business by buying a buffalo to support her family. With the passage of time, her sales have increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business and she hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en: Nosheen is a 27-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she started her own business of clothes sales. She buys clothes of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them for profit in her community. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She is the mother of two children, both in school. She has gradually improved her business and now has requested a loan of PKR 30,000. She is going to use this loan to buy a variety of clothes for the summer season in different colors and designs to inflate her sales. She wishes to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for the summer season in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Walter Flavio

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Walter no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con su familia por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, Walter se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra Maíz, Walter trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Walter se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de abono, riego y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Walter asegurará el buen desarrollo de su cultivo de maíz, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Walter is a 45 year old man. He lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and two young children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a kind, hard working and enthusiastic person who with his wife puts all of his effort into getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, sue to a lack of resources and out a need to work from when he was very young, Walter was unable to study agriculture as he would have liked to do. In his free time, he likes to go out with his family through the pleasant streets of his city.

With much hard work and dedication and thanks to what his parents taught him, Walter works in agriculture. He has a small land parcel where he plants corn. Walter works every day doing farm work, and he can work for about 10 hours a day. He is content doing his labor and thinks it is going well for him because of his experience and the kind way he treats others.

Walter is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given he will be able to cover the costs of fertilizer, irrigation and harvesting of his crop. In this way, Walter will ensure the good development of his corn crop. He will keep working and striving to achieve his big dream of building his house.

loans.use: to cover expenses for fertilizer, irrigation and harvesting for his crop.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 36-year-old, single mother of two children, aged 11 and seven years, respectively. She sells clothes, a business she ventured into three years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Serah has requested a third loan of KES 60,000 to purchase bales of children's wear. The profit she earns will aid her in educating her children. 

Serah's dreams are to see this business expand and to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase bales of children's wear to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 28 years old.  She is married and blessed with two children, aged six and three years respectively . She sells milk  besides dairy farming. She started selling milk four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES. 60,000 to purchase more milk to meet the high demand from her customers. The profit she earns will help her pay school fees for her children. 

Her dream is to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses in order to get more income.

loans.use: To purchase milk for sale

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran, age 37, works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for three years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family.  She is a mother of five; among them three are school-aged.  She needs to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. To complete the orders of her customers on time, she needs to purchase more spools of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zippers. For this reason she applied for a loan of Rs.30,000. She is in her 2nd loan cycle, with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and packs of buttons, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She has a business of selling poultry and retail items. She applied for a loan of 800000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of maize bran, small fish, sea shells and salt. She generates additional income from hiring out a motorcycle. She works from home and sells retail seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of maize bran. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked shop of animal feeds. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize bran, sea shells, salt and small fish.

loans.name: Qutaibah

texts.en: Qutaibah is a 21 years old and has four siblings. Qutaibah and one of his brothers are university students which makes it hard for his family to support both of them. Quatibah is applying for an educational loan to pay for his semester fees and continue majoring in graphic design studies.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah is 48 years old, married to Daniel, and blessed with five children, aged 25, 23, 20, 14, and 12 years, respectively. Theresah practices dairy farming and poultry-keeping, a practice she started five years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Theresah has requested a second loan of KES 100,000 to purchase animal feed. The profit she earns will help her build rental houses on her piece of land. 

She hopes to have a regular, stable source of income in order for her family to live well.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed for her cattle and chicken.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, situated at the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for seven years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

Fridah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan request due to its low interest rates, seeing them as ideal for small-scale farmers. She will use the money to purchase irrigation equipment for her farm. The resulting increase in profits will help her in educating her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Fridah owns the following: a cow, poultry and a motorcycle. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in her household mosquito nets, electricity, running water, a television and dvd player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To pay for irrigation equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This group of women from Iraq requested to remain anonymous on Kiva. The group leader is 31 years old and she is engaged to be married soon.

With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has three years' experience working with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. She would like to offer her customers more options and a variety of creative designs to choose from and would like to buy an over-lock machine and an embroidery machine, as well as some nice quality fabrics and raw materials. To be able to make these purchases and make nicer dresses for women and children, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an over-lock machine and an embroidery machine, and good quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been running a business in animal sales and purchases for four years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She also milks cows and sells milk to her neighbours to generate an extra profit. 

Bushra is a mother of six children and dreams to provide them with a better standard of living. She believes that this will not be possible unless she works towards the expansion of her business. For this reason Bushra has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy one more cow. 

Bushra has been in association with Kashf foundation for two years. She hopes to raise a profit from her business and plans to set aside some savings for her children's well being.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en: Ameena is a 55-year-old married woman; she works in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. Ameena dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 27 years old. She is a mother of two children, ages six and nine, and they both go to school. 

With the loan, Lea would like to buy more beers and sodas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Ekutan

texts.en:
Ekutan is 35 years old, married to Rebecca, and blessed with two children, ages four and one year, respectively. He provides transport services by his motorbike, a business he started three years ago and he earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

Ekutan has requested a first loan of KES 10,000 to service his motorbike. The profit he earns will aid him in expanding this business. He hopes to own a taxi one day.

loans.use: to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his school fees for himself.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is married and has nine children who attend school. He lives in his own house that has no electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past twenty years, he has operated a goat meat-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft of the goats at times and he dreams of expanding to his own premises of sale.

With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 50,000 he wants to purchase six goats to resell to his customers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase six goats to resell to his customers.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
La señora  Digna  de  49  años  de edad es madre soltera  vive con sus  dos hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en la comunidad de san Lorenzo al sur de honduras, se dedica desde hace 16 años al negocio de pulpería,  en su negocio ella vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, atiende a sus vecinos y demás personas que la visitan a diario de lunes a domingo, doña Digna es una mujer trabajadora que se ha sacrificado por sacar adelante a sus hijos sola, es un ejemplo de trabajo y honestidad.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de lácteos, frescos, churros, abarrotería en general ella necesita el préstamo para surtir mas su negocio,  con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende, mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con prisma,  es su tercer préstamo que solicita. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.
San Lorenzo, honduras- 06 de junio del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. Digna is 49-years old, a single mother, and lives with her two children in their home located in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. For sixteen years she has run a grocery store selling all items that are in daily use. Her customers are neighbours and other people who come to her store which is open seven days a week.

Dina is a hardworking woman who has done all she could to help her children get ahead. She epitomizes hard work and honesty. She is now seeking a loan to buy dairy products, soft drinks, doughnuts, and groceries in general to better stock her store. With this assistance she expects to improve her income. Dogma is very happy to continue working with Prisma; this is her third loan. Her dream is to improve her store even more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras
June 6, 2013

loans.use: buy dairy products, soft drinks, doughnuts, and groceries in general

loans.name: Yulisa Katerine

texts.es:
Yulisa es una joven de 18 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Yulisa no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yulisa trabaja como obrera en el área de manualidades de una empresa textil de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yulisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que al acercarse la época de lluvias necesita refaccionar el techado y las ventanas de una habitación, de esta manera Yulisa y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Yulisa is 18 years old, single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings. She is a friendly, hard working, and an enthusiastic person who has a drive to succeed. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, and because she needed to work to support her parents, Yulisa was not able to get a business degree like she wanted. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and on occasion she cooks a delicious dish called Carapulcra con Sopa Seca to share with her family. 

On her own initiative, and through hard work and determination, Yulisa works in handicrafts and the textile industry that is important in her area. She works everyday for about 10 hours and she believes that things are going well because she performs well at her work and because she is friendly to everyone. 

Yulisa is very thankful to the lenders of Kiva and, thanks to their help, she will be able to complete the improvement of her home. The rainy season is approaching and she needs to reinforce her roof and the windows in her home. Yulisa will be able to help her family have more security and improve their well-being. And so, she will continue working and striving to achieve her dream of completing her studies for a professional career.

loans.use: improve her home.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 28-year-old conservative single lady. She asked her father to appear in the photo instead.
 
Safaa is the oldest sister of three siblings. She is majoring in Banking and Finance at one of the Jordanian universities. Now Safaa is applying for an educational loan to help her father in paying her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Dúo Mision Santa Group

texts.es: Dúo Mision Santa, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Emiliana,que tiene 34 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos, se a dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, esta muy contenta porque cada dia su negocio ha ido creciendo por ese motivo ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos
texts.en:
The Dúo Mision Santa group includes Maria Emiliana, a 34-year-old woman. 

She produces and sells traditional weavings. She has done this business for many years. She is very happy because her business has grown more and more each day. For this reason, she is seeking this loan in order to buy raw materials for the production of traditional weavings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production of traditional weavings.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, a 27-year-old married lady, has operated a beauty parlor for five years, offering a variety of services including makeup, hair styling and facials. Through the quality of her work she has become very popular on her street.

In order to meet increasing customer demand, Bushra is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. Now requesting her third loan from Kashf Foundation for Rs. 40,000, she will purchase hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. Bushra hopes to cater to more customers as a result of her loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is aged 32. She is married with one child. She sells superglue to use on shoes and rubber for shoes. 

With this loan, Speciose would like to buy rubber and shoe polish to sell. With the profits from the business she will make savings.

loans.use: to buy more rubbers and shoe polish to sell.

loans.name: Yakeline

texts.es:
Yakeline de 36 años de edad, es madre cabeza de familia de un hijo de doce años.  Tras sufrir el abandono de su esposo, esta mujer tomó las obligaciones del hogar con el propósito de sacar su familia adelante. 
Decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancía en un pequeño local del municipio de Rionegro.
 
En la actualidad, Yakeline tiene mucha clientela, la cual le solicita constantemente artículos variados; con el fin de satisfacer esta demanda, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de blusas, jeans y accesorios. 
Su mayor deseo, es brindarle a su hijo una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Yakeline, a 36-year-old woman, is a mother to her 12-year-old son and the head of her household. After suffering the abandonment of her husband, this woman assumed the household responsibilities with the goal of getting her family ahead. 

She decided to make a living selling merchandise in a small storefront in the town of Rionegro. Currently, Yakeline has many customers who constantly request a variety of things from her. With the goal of satisfying this demand, she requests this loan, which she will use to purchase shirts, jeans, and accessories. 

Her greatest wish is to give her son a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, and accessories.

loans.name: Serah Kainyu

texts.en:
Serah lives in Eastern Kenya in a place called Tharaka-Nithi. Her home neighbors Mount Kenya, one of Kenya's main water sources. Like her neighbors, she has been affected by weather changes and a decrease in water supply due to the increasing deforestation around Mount Kenya. Being a farmer this has affected her crop production, which is her main source of income. Sarah uses charcoal and firewood for cooking and kerosene for lighting because there is no electricity connection in her home. Every month she spends approximately $35 without counting the time and energy used to collect firewood. She and her two daughters are also at risk of sexual harassment from forest guards when they go to collect wood. 

To save her from all these challenges, the Visionary Empowerment Programme team encouraged her to construct a biodigester, as she has four cows from which she can get fuel for cooking. VEP also sold her a solar package so she can have sufficient light to enable her four children to study in the evening without limitations. 

Serah is now an empowered woman and will educate others in her village to embrace green energy as well. With her savings and income from the sale of milk and maize she will comfortably repay the loan.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester and purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, located at the slopes of Mt.Kenya. She has one child and has been doing this work for five years.  Her primary income sources are sales of milk, eggs, tea, crops and her personal business.

She has stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'The interest I get from it.'  Her biggest challenge is a 'lack of capital.'  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Mutune.'

Caroline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Juhudi are very friendly to their clients.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinance is the most convenient way to borrow for low earners.'

Caroline's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'how will this loan benefit her family?', Caroline replied 'I will educate my child.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Caroline owns the following: a cow, poultry and a bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, running water and a TV but does not have electricity, a sewing machine or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase rabbits.

loans.name: Enriqueta America

texts.es: Doña Enriqueta de 43 años de edad es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Doña Enriqueta esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella  ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Doña Enriqueta is 43 years old and she is very friendly and hard working. She lives with her husband and her three children. She works hard on her own parcel of land where she sows corn and beans. Her products are of a good quality and she sells them in different markets that are close to her home. Doña Enriqueta is asking for a loan with INTEGRAL in order to raise the necessary fund to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as plague control, fertilizers, manure, seeds and other things she needs for her harvest. She is anxious to increase her sales and to be able to earn more money and to give her family a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: purchase plague control, fertilizers, manure, seeds etc.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, el se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son frescos y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, juan esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar pescado por mayor para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
39-year old Juan lives in his own house with his wife and three children. For several years he has earned his living selling fish from his home. He has many customers because his products are fresh and a fair price. With the money he earns, Juan manages to pay for household expenses.

He is seeking a loan to buy fish at wholesale prices so he can continue with his business and be able to provide his family with better financial stability.

loans.use: Buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is married with two children, one in high school and the other in primary school. He and his wife practice dairy farming, from which they earn income to cater for their needs and for their children's school fees. They are able to sell approximately 50 liters of milk to a local processing plant. In addition, they rear a few bulls for sale. 

Every month Johnson and his family spend approximately $22 on firewood, $14 on charcoal, and $17 on electricity. Then he learned that he could save money on fuel by constructing a biodigester.

Being a member of VEP, he has been advanced a loan for the biodigester materials and construction, which is done by a VEP mason. With the biodigester he will be able to save at least $40 per month on fuel, as he will not need to buy firewood and charcoal, and his electricity bill will decrease because he will also use the biogas for lighting. 

Johnson's life will improve as these savings can be used to start up other income-generating projects as well as facilitate repayment of the loan.

The slurry, a byproduct of biogas, will be very helpful in growing fodder for his animals so he will not have to spend money on buying fertilizer as well.

He is really grateful that he is able to build a biodigester that he could not afford without a credit facility.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother of two girls in secondary school living in Kirinyaga county in central Kenya. She has a coffee and tea farm and also practices dairy farming. She has three cows from which she sells around 20 liters of milk per day. 

Her farm income is used for her children's school fees and for their daily needs. Because she does not have electricity at home, she uses kerosene for light and firewood and charcoal for cooking. These fuel expenses cost her approximately $57 per month.

To save her this amount of money, VEP recommended that she install a biodigester at her home. The biodigester will produce gas that she will use for cooking and lighting. After receiving training, she took a loan, and a biodigester is now under construction at her home.

Gladys and her family will have a better life free from the drudgery of collecting firewood and using smoky kitchens.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester

loans.name: Dúo Getzemani Group

texts.es:
DUO GETZEMANI
Es integrada por las señoras María Felipa de 58 años de edad originaria del Municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, doña Felipa es madre de familia tiene una niña de 16 años de edad, desde ya hace más de 25 años doña Felipa se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, tejido de servilletas, y elaboración de costura en los cortes típicos de  su localidad, de esta manera ella ha logrado mantener su pequeño hogar,es asi como ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos para la venta.
texts.en:
One of the two members of the Getzemani group is 58-year old María Felipa, a native of the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez. She has a 16-year old daughter. For more than 25 years Sra. Felipa has sold clothing and woven napkins, and made the traditional dress typical of the area. Through these activities she has managed to maintain her small house.

This loan will allow her to buy the fabric and weaving supplies she needs to make traditional clothing to sell.

loans.use: buy fabric and weaving supplies to make traditional clothing

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 25 year-old, single man, who has worked in agriculture for two years. He has a tractor which he uses for ploughing agricultural land. His business is in high demand in his region since most of his regional citizens work in agriculture and request a fast service, which he can provide. He also sells water to irrigate the land with the help of a small container attached to his tractor.

Husein is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to change his tractor's tyres, because it is very important to have them in good shape to do his work easily.

In the future, he hopes to be able to buy all the necessary agricultural tools to reply to any special request from local farmers.

loans.use: to change his tractor's tyres.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of selling bed covers and sofa covers for the past 5 years. She purchases a wide variety of bed sheets and covers from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has a number of customers and is able to generate enough income to fulfill the demands of her family members. 

At present, Shehnaz is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase bed covers, spreads and sofa covers in different designs and colors by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. This loan will help her to generate more income which she will use to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bed covers, spreads and sofa covers in different designs and colors.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 42-year-old man from Shienwe location in Kakamega county. He supports six people in his family. He is married to Mildred who is also a business lady within the same town. Fredrick has six children who are 18, 15, 12, 9, 6 and 1 year old respectively.

He has a general store where he sells general goods like ropes, mats and baskets. He has been operating this kind of business for the last 13 years and generates a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

Fredrick is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more stock of ropes, baskets and plastic plates for resale. He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

His dream is to expand his business and become stable so as to support his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy ropes, baskets and plastic plates.

loans.name: Joise

texts.en:
Joise is a 51-year-old married woman. Five years ago she started a business of selling fabric in her community. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them in her area. She works day and night to improve the living conditions of her family. She makes enough revenue to meet the daily demands of her family. 

She applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy different fabrics such as lawn and chiffon, according to her customers' demands. She believes that this loan will be helpful in business expansion and wishes to spend part of revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics such as lawn and chiffon, according to customers' demands.

loans.name: Valence

texts.en: Valence is 42 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to buy engine oil for use in his transport business. He has been running this business for eight years. He plans to use the profits for building a house.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for resale.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms Shamim is a 41-year-old lady. She has been running her tailoring business for the past eight years. She is expert in stitching stylish dresses for the ladies of her community.  Her husband is a barber whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family alone. That is why Shamim is working hard to provide her six children with good quality food, health and education. 

Due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers so she applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of laces and zippers. She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Alianne

texts.en: Alianne is 32 years old. She owns a retail business, selling different items. With the loan, she would like to add more rice, soaps and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soaps and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. Margret has three children and she has been doing dairy work for three years. Her primary income sources are milk and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "milking." Her biggest challenge is: "feeding my animals." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Cheboit."

Margret was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "training on credit management."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "record-keeping."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?," Margret replied, "I will get milk to feed my family."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Margret owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, TV,' but does not have: 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mumo

texts.en:
Mumo is married and they are blessed with 10 children. They live at their own house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees and food for the family.

He operates a goat meat selling business. He cites seasonality and stiff competition from other operators to be his major challenges. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase 5 goats for resale to meet the needs of his clients and to ensure the continuous productivity of the business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 goats for resale to meet the needs of his clients and ensure continuous productivity.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is age 39. She is married with four children. With the loan, she would like to buy more quantities of honey for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more honey for resale.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 28 years old. She sells meat and has been in the business for nine years. She has four children; two of them go to school. 

The loan Epiphanie has requested will be used to buy more meat for sale at the butcher shop. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Lucia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 27 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres, a quienes ama y agradece todo su apoyo, Rosa es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Rosa no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja como cajera en un internet de su ciudad, ella brinda servicios de atención al cliente, trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Rosa se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias  a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente cuenta con una cocina a kerosene que presenta desperfectos y su uso es peligroso, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar al preparar sus alimentos, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 27 year old young woman, and she is single.  She lives in the city of Ica in the Parcona district with her parents, whom she loves very much.  She is grateful for all of their support.  Rosa is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She puts all of her efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work, Rosa was not able to study the business administration profession that she would have liked to.  In her free time she likes to listen to music.  Sometimes she makes the delicious ‘Tallarines Rojos’ [similar to spaghetti] to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with great determination and dedication, Rosa works as a cashier at an internet cafe in her city.  She provides customer services, and she works every day.  She starts at the very early hours of the morning, and she is able to work for approximately ten hours.  Rosa likes doing her work, and she believes that it is going well for her due to the kind way that she treats others.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to buy a stove.  She currently has a kerosene stove, which is damaged, and using it is dangerous.  This way she and her family will be safer and better off when preparing their food.  This way Rosa will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to fulfill her big dream of being able to study for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is 47 years old. He lives in the small village of Gurjaani District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandson.

On several occasions, Goderdzi requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, each time without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.

Goderdzi works as an artisan and earns a modest monthly income. His wife works locally as a baker. Their earnings provide hardly enough income to purchase food for the family. According to Credo estimates, their family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Goderdzi requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Goderdzi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with lenient conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high-risk borrowers because of their low incomes.

With the loan proceeds that he is requesting, Goderdzi would like to begin trading livestock. Specifically, he plans to purchase calves, and to raise and re-sell them at higher prices for profits. He believes that such an operation would significantly increase his family's income. And, as a result, he feel that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a livestock trading business by purchasing calves and later raising and re-selling them at higher prices

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children, two of whom are school-going. The man shown in the picture is Nasreen’s husband.  They have been running a business of agriculture for many years to improve the living conditions of their family. They grow and harvest seasonal vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market on a daily basis. They sell fresh fruits and vegetables, and that’s why their demands are increasing day by day. 

Now Nasreen is asking for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf foundation. She hopes that this new loan will allow her to generate more revenue for having better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different types of seeds as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  is widowed with two children. One of her children goes to school. Justine also takes care of additional family members (old mother). 

She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,800,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, bags of rice, blue band, wheat flour, and maize flour. 

Justine generates additional income through farming. She works in a shop and sells both retail and wholesale, seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

Justine aspires to own a big supermarket and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, bags of rice, blue band, wheat flour, and maize flour to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su compañera de vida, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 4 y 10 años. El, se dedica a las  la cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, lo realiza desde hace 15 años, todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; este le ayudara a tener los insumos agrícolas necesarios en el momento oportuno para llevar a cabo el cultivo.
Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his life partner and he has two children aged 4 and 10. He has been engaged in planting basic grains such as corn and beans for 15 years, working every day from 6 am to 3 pm, and up to now he has not encountered any difficulties.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure, weed killers, insecticides, pesticides, pest-control substances and other supplies; this will help him having all the farming supplies he needs right where he needs them for the full growth of his crops.
He dreams of helping his children with their studies and of granting a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy manure, weed killers, insecticides, pesticides and pest-control substance.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man blessed with seven children. All of his children attend school. He and his family live in their own house, which has no electricity or piped water.

To earn a living, he has operated a meat (goat) selling business for over five years. He operates his business at the market, where neighbors are his customers. He notes that the main business challenge he faces is stiff competition in the area.

With the requested loan in the amount of 50,000 KES, he wants to purchase 12 goats for re-sale. He believes that the loan will help him expand his business and earn additional income to better support his family. He aspires to open his own store for easier operations.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing 12 goats for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y maicillo. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The client lives with his family in his own house.  He is a farmer, and he grows corn and sorghum.  He has been engaged in this business activity for several years.  This is how he earns his daily bread.  He is a hard-working and responsible man.  He is very well-known in the area for his enormous heart and his kindness to others.

Because it is now the planting season, he made the decision to begin preparing.  That is why he has decided to request a new loan from Integral.  He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc.  What he wants the most is for his harvest to be abundant and to be better than the previous ones.  This is the way that he supports his family.  He trusts in God, that with his help, and his dedication and determination in his work, he will fulfill his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married and has children who attend school. Mercy has had a home-based grocery store for years. Aside from the usual grocery items, she also sells cooked chapati (flat bread) that generates extra income, especially on the weekend. She’s requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, and noodles at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, and noodles at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve her salon by purchasing a special peeling machine and cosmetic supplies and by advertising (e.g., publicity through a website).

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Monsieur Oumar est un natif du quartier qui évolue dans le commerce de baches, poutres et toiles. Il est marié et père de famille. Il a une expérience de 10ans dans son activité, Oumar gère les charges de la familles telles que les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité.Monsieur Oumar sollicite ce pret d'un montant de 500 000F pour acheter des baches, poutres et toiles qu'il va revendre à ses clients. Durant la période de la saison des pluies les baches et toiles sont très sollicités pour la couverture des toits. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour quitter le marché à 19h. A l'avenir il souhaite augmenter ses revenus avec l'aide de l'IMCEC et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Monsieur Oumar grew up in the quarter in which he sells tarpaulin, beams and canvas for a living. He is married with children. He has worked in his field for 10 years. Oumar looks after the family's needs, such as daily expenditures and school fees. Monsieur Oumar is seeking a loan of 500,000 F in order to purchase tarpaulin, beams and canvas which he sells to his customers. During the rainy season the tarpaulin and canvas is in high demand for use in roof covering. Monsieur Oumar begins his day at 8am and finishes at 7pm. In future he would like to boost his revenues with the help of IMCEC, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tarpaulin, beams, and canvas for re-sale, primarily in winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials, a hair washing station, chairs, a treatment table, and cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en: Rosine is 26 years old and single. She has run a canteen for the past four years. She has requested a loan to buy more fresh milk and soda to sell. She plans to use the profits to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more milk and soda to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kisauni, is married, lives in her own home, and has children. She works hard and tirelessly to be able to give them everything that they need to have a good life without privations.

Constance has been the owner of a food store for the past year. This couple works hard for their family, and they are asking for the opportunity to continue to grow. She is asking for a loan for the purchase of inputs for the store. She wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given, since this will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Theodore

texts.en: Theodore is 25 years old. He is single and sells various items in his boutique. He would like to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 51 years old. She lives in Gurjaani District with her husband, two children, daughter-in-law and grandson.

On several occasios, Nino requested loans from local financial institutions for family business start-ups, each time without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is her husband's and son's monthly salaries. Both of them work as salesmen. But their earnings provide hardly enough income to put food on the table for the family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Nino requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Nino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with lenient conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high-risk borrowers because of their low incomes.

With the loan proceeds that she is requesting, Nino would like to begin trading used clothing. Specifically, she plans to purchase used clothing from the wholesalers in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, and to then re-sell such clothing in Gurjaani at higher prices. She believes that, by doing so, she will increase her family's income. And in this way, she feels that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling used clothing

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es: Camilo de 48 años de edad, habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hija de 24 años. Con una experiencia de 28 años de trabajar en una industria de productos capilares, enfocó su idea de negocio hacia la comercialización de cremas, champo, enjuagues etc. y haciendo cursos técnicos logró aprender y perfeccionar la preparación de los mismos. Sus principales productos son la cremas para alisar,  neutralizantes, siliconas, los cuales distribuye entre su clientela que ha logrado vendiéndole sus productos puerta a puerta y en la modalidad de crédito y de contado. En la actualidad requiere vender en mayor volumen y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la demanda y por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a su primer crédito, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como glicerinas, colorantes, botellas y tapas para aumentar su producción y vender mucho mas. Con ello sus compras se aumentarán, por el volumen obtenido y sus costos de producción se disminuirán y esta es justamente la razón por la cual su credikiva será exitoso.
texts.en: Camilo is 48 years old, and he lives in the southern area of his town with his wife and their daughter, aged 24. Having spent 28 years working for a hair products company, he has focused his business idea on selling creams, shampoos, rinses and so on. He has attended a few technical courses, thus succeeding in learning and perfecting their production. His mainly produces sleeking creams, neutralizers and silicone which he sells to the customers he has gained by selling his products door to door on credit and as well as for cash. He currently wants to sell bigger quantities, but his working capital is not enough to meet his customers’ requests; for this reason he has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to ask for his first loan. He will use it to buy supplies and ingredients such as glycerin, coloring, bottles and lids to increase his production and sell more products. This will increase the volume of sold products, so that his production costs will diminish, and this is the reason why his loan will be profitable.

loans.use: To buy glycerin, coloring, bottles and lids.

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es: Adonay de 65 años de edad, desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y sorgo, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 11 años de edad. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente. Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Adonay, age 65, has been cultivating the land for many years.  He grows corn and sorghum with great dedication.  This allows him to bring home the daily bread to his household.  He is known for being a hard-working, honest, and responsible man.  He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and their three children, ages 16, 15, and 11.  Together with his wife, they work very hard in order to get their family ahead and to give them better living conditions than what they had.

Thanks to his knowledge of farming, he manages to support his household.  It is his main source of income, given that it is the only way he knows to earn an honest living.

With a great desire for improvement, he approached the institution in order to request a loan.  This is because planting season has started, and he needs to start planting as soon as possible.  That is the reason he is requesting the loan.  He needs to buy the agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc. in order to plant.

He trusts in God and in his work that this way he will manage to have an abundant harvest.  The harvest will allow him to access a better quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides, etc

loans.name: Osinatu

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Osinatu. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 15. In 1994, Osinatu established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to generate enough cash to support her children and this is her only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. 

Osinatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Osinatu requires a loan in order to buy window cotton, obama wax, and simple lace and guarantee wax. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Osinatu plans to educate her kids, to develop her plot of land, and to rent a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy window cotton, obama wax, and simple lace and guarantee wax.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is a 36-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells food in her community to earn a living. She has just decided to operate a food stall business selling pork cake, donuts, mince pie, and ice cake, but she has been cooking and baking for many years. Maia needs a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, mutton flaps, sacks of onions, salt, soya, foam cups, cordial, sugar, and garlic for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to maintain her business. Maia has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her business

loans.name: La Fe 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Armita is the coordinator of her group La Fe 1, 2 & 3 (The Faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to educate her children and to support all of their needs. She sells clothing and accessories, a business she enjoys doing.

Armita is excited to be taking out her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for four years. She plans to use this loan to purchase blue jeans, cosmetics and women's shoes etc. She will use the profits to provide for her family needs.

This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 45 años de edad , está casado y tiene 7 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en la casa que compraron hace 17 años.La zona donde habita, es un paraje alejado, que aparte de poseer un buen paisaje tiene tierras muy fértiles. Desde muy joven comenzó su camino por la agricultura, aprovechando las cualidades de la tierra. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en los sembríos de habas, alverja, papa y maíz, los cuales cuida constantemente, ya que necesita de los nutrientes necesarios para poder adquirir productos de calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer los alimentos de la tierra, pero le molesta las variaciones constantes que existe en el mercado, por lo que a veces no sabe si obtendrá buenas ganancias. Pero eso no lo desanima ya que comenzó con la crianza de animales menores como chanchos y gallinas, los cuales vende a buen precio después de engordarlos. Además de tener compradores fijos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad.Félix, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Félix is 45 years old, he is married and he has 7 children whom he cares for with deep love and affection in the house he bought 17 years ago. He lives in a secluded area, blessed with beautiful landscapes as well as rich soils. He started his path on agriculture since he was very young, taking advantage of the good quality if the lands. He presently counts on a 5-years’ experience in planting broad beans, peas, potatoes and corn; he cares for his crops constantly because they need the proper nourishment to obtain good quality products. Being able to watch products growth on his land is what he mostly likes about his job; what he doesn't like are the constant changes in market prices, as at times he doesn’t know whether he will earn a good income. However, this does not discourage him because on top of counting on fixed customers in the wholesalers’ market of his town, he has also started breeding small animals such as pigs and chickens, which he sells for a good price after having fattened them. Félix will invest the 2500 PEN in the purchase of manure to feed his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Caminando Hacia Al Progreso 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Leocadia is one of the members of the group Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking to the Future) 1 & 7. This group is located in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris, where the group's members sell various products like foods, clothes, shoes, etc.

Leocadia makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. For the past five years she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall where, in addition to fruits and vegetables she sells meat, charcoal, etc. She started her business with her own savings.

Leocadia is excited to be a part of this loan, her 10th with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan portions and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business inventory by buying plantains, onions, cassava, bananas, oranges, chickens, coriander, greens products, etc.
