Leocadia says that her most difficult challenges are improving her business and helping her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, fruits and other goods.

loans.name: Dionicia Amanda

texts.es: La socia Zenobia nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura y también a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Zenobia was born in the city of Pilco-Grande, and she lives in the same city where she war born.  She is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six children.

She works in agriculture, and she also raises small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and others.

She needs the loan to buy small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

(The Pilco-Grande community is in the Huayllabamba district in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Matainofo

texts.en: Matainofo is a 28-year-old married woman with one child. She runs a plantation business which has been in operation for many years. Matainofo is requesting a loan to assist her in purchasing chemicals and fertiliser for improving her plantation; iron roofing, timber, nails and cement to help with her home renovation; and school uniforms for her child. Matainofo hopes to maintain her plantation business and use some of the profits to assist with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, fertiliser, timber, cement, iron roofing, nails, and school uniforms.

loans.name: Martina Elena

texts.es: Doña Martina de 48 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo, doña Martina es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Martina  desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Martina, who is 48 years old, lives with her husband and son. Martina is very responsible, and her main priority is providing for her family. She owns a tortilla stand, where she makes tortillas every midday and every night. Her business is located in her home. 

Martina really wants to improve her business, because it provides her with a very stable income, which allows her to support her family. That is why she is requesting a loan, so that she can purchase wholesale corn and lime in order to make larger quantities of tortillas, especially on the weekends when demand increases due to many other tortilla shops being closed. This will allow her to obtain a higher profit, which in turn will help her gain more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Taua

texts.en:
Taua is 26 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling popcorn in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy popcorn, oil, an oven, plastic bags, salt, and kerosene. 

In the future,Taua hopes to earn more profit to improve her business, and to help her children's education. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, oil, an oven, plastic bags, salt, and kerosene for her popcorn business.

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is thirty years old and has three children aged between three and six years. He runs a music business.

Marc is applying for a 500,000 RWF loan through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy a laptop for use in his music business. He plans to use the profits for paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for use in his music business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger amount and variety of gowns.

loans.name: Ibrahim H.

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married, and has three children ages 17, 8, and 8. They all go to school. He has two additional dependents who he is fostering and live with him.  

In 2005, Ibrahim established his business selling soft and hard drinks, cigarettes, black mints, etc.  He began his business because he stopped in Class 7 due to lack of financial support; his elder sister drew him into business.  He later worked as a salesman for some years; he saved his salary and used it to establish a boutique business which he has now changed to a bar.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,585,000 every month from this business. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. 

He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Ibrahim would use the loan to buy different kinds of drinks - soft, energy and hard drinks. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to develop the bar into a guest house, educate his children, and build a house.  This house will help achieve some of his future plans.  

He thanks you for your support, and for financing his business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of drinks - soft drinks, energy drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Kyembare  Group

texts.en:
Juliet has six children and is a first-time borrower. She is part of the Kyembare Group that is applying for a group loan of 4,300,000 UGX through UGAFODE. (The man squatting in the foreground is the UGAFODE credit officer.) When apportioned out among the group’s thirteen members, she will receive 300,000 UGX to use.

Juliet is a farmer who grows bananas for a living. With her loan she plans to buy organic fertilizers for her banana plantation in order to improve its productivity. She is hardworking and resilient and is grateful for her partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Doña Matilde de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia  tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, doña Matilde esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar ropa por mayor como: blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc. y seguir con su negocio para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Matilde is 55 years old, and she lives with her husband and son in their own home. For several years now Matilde has operated a clothing sales business out of her home, and she has worked hard to grow her customer base. She offers high quality products and leverages the income from the business to cover household expenses. 

With the support from this loan, Matilde plans to purchase clothing in bulk, including: blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen her business and provide increased financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su hermana y su cuñado en casa de su padre, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 3 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. La clienta ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
This borrower lives with her sister and brother-in-law in her father's home, and she has worked for the past three years farming corn and beans to make a living. She is a very hardworking, honorable and responsible woman, and the yearly farming cycle is the only way she knows how to make a living.

With the support from this loan, the borrower plans to purchase agricultural input items for tending her crops, including: manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc. She hopes that this investment will strengthen her crops and farming operation, as it is her only source of income. She has faith that she will be able to have an abundant harvest which will allow her to continue putting food on the table for her family.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Lee

texts.en:
Lee has been farming since he was born. His parents came from Laos as refugees in 1979. Lee's father had helped the Americans in the war effort. When they arrived in the U.S., they started their own small farm to make ends meet and stay productive. 

Lee followed in his parent's footsteps and started his own farm in 2012, successfully farming 10 acres of tomatoes, green beans, eggplant and other specialty Asian crops. He received a loan from Fresno CDFI to start the farm and repaid the loan in full.

Lee's farm is located on the outskirts of Fresno. He is now getting ready for the harvest season. He sells his products to local packing houses and wholesalers. Lee is requesting $5,000 to pay his harvesting crew as well as for fertilizer and other supplies for the farm. Savings from a Fresno CDFI Individual Development Account (savings match program) will supplement loan proceeds.

loans.use: to pay his harvesting crew and pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a twenty-year-old married woman with three children. She sells charcoal for a living. Because of her increase in clientele she is applying for a 40,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy more charcoal to keep up with her customers’ orders.

Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Providance

texts.en: Providance is 45 years old and is married with six children. For the past ten years she has sold bed sheets and fabric. She is applying for a 800,000 RWF through Urwego to buy more bed sheets and curtains to sell. Her profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and curtains to sell

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 33 and single. For the past eight years he has operated a bar.

Fabien is applying for a 800,000 RWF through Urwego to buy more beer and water to sell. He plans to use the profits to renovate his house. He is very happy with the way his business is prospering.

loans.use: To buy more beer and water to sell.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide is 40 years old. He is the father of four children between the ages of 7 and 13; all of them go to school. 

With the loan, he wants to add more mineral water, packed milk, and sodas to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items such as biscuits, sodas, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Samuel Humberto

texts.es: Don Samuel de 46 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus seis hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, don Samuel se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, abonos, herbicidas, etc. don Samuel tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Samuel is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their six children. He makes a living farming corn and beans, a trade he has mastered over many years. Samuel is well known in his area, and he has worked very hard to build his customer base. He always harvests high quality crops, and he sells his produce at affordable prices and with excellent service. Samuel is a kind, entrepreneurial man who works very hard to get ahead in life.

Since his most recent harvest did not yield the harvest he had hoped for, Samuel plans to use the support from this loan to purchase agricultural input items for tending his crops, including: seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc. He hopes that this investment will help him to strengthen his farming operation and provide a better quality of life for his family. With an impeccable reputation and work ethic, Samuel is confident that he can make all loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc. for his farming operation.

loans.name: Anatalie

texts.en:
Anatalie aged 49. She is a widow with four children; they all attend high school. 

Anatalie sells scraps of different kinds that can be used for things such as vehicles and buildings. 

With the loan, she plans to buy more scraps to sell. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more scraps for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y maicillo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc.  y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: This borrower has been a farmer for a number of years, and this has given him the ability and knowledge he needs to tend to his crops.  He mainly grows corn and sorghum.  He sells his crops to the agencies who buy staple grains that are located close the place where he lives.  With the earnings he gets from his sales, he helps with the family's expenses.  He lives in his own home with his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help him to put in his crops, such as: manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.  This way, he can have better earnings and continue to provide support for the household expenditures as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and other supplies

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh was born in 1991. He lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. He studies Financial Management and Services at the Foreign Trade University (www.ftu.edu.vn/). His studies last four years, and he will graduate in 2014. He is the first person in his family to graduate high school and go on to study at the university. 

His parents have a grocery store and receive 20,000,000 VND per month. His mother is a member of SEDA’s credit program, too. 

Linh is aware that studying will give him opportunities to find a good job and gain more money. He chose this area of study because of his passion for business. He wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to buy a computer; this loan suits his family’s situation and income.  

The loan is disbursed fast and conveniently right after completing the paper work. 

Besides lacking of funds for his educational fees, he has other difficulties like house renting fees, and transportation. 

He appreciates the lenders of this program, and he will try his best to study and work for the best future.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Sandra Milagros

texts.es:
Sandra es una jovencita de 22 años que vive con su familia.
Sandra  estudia Administración en la universidad. Ella ha elegido esta carrera porque tiene mucho futuro y le permitirá desarrollar su profesión en diversos ámbitos laborales. La profesión de Sandra dura 05 años de los cuales lleva estudiando 02, diariamente le dedica 10 horas a sus estudios; actualmente labora como practicante en el área administrativa de una empresa reconocida, el préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá para el pago de sus pensiones y comprar algunos materiales de estudio. Sandra está contenta por la oportunidad y la confianza, en un futuro cercano sueña con ser una persona productiva para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old and lives with her family. She is studying administration at the university level, and she chose this career path because of the wide variety of opportunities it can open up for her in the future. In her second year of in the 5-year program, Sandra dedicates 10 hours every day to her studies. In addition, she is also working as an administrative intern at a well known business in her town. 

With the support from this loan, Sandra plans to pay her university tuition as well as cover the cost of books and study materials. She is grateful for this opportunity and the support she has received, and she plans to put her studies to good use by getting a job to support her family.

loans.use: to cover tuition and study materials for her university program.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y fríjol, desde hace 5 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de compra de  granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. El cliente solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, semillas, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his life partner and his child.  He has been growing corn and beans for five years.  This has given him the needed experience in order to take care of his crops.  He sells his harvests at the markets that sell basic crops.  With the earnings that he gets from his sales he manages to pay the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to improve the land where he plans to plant.  He will also buy the needed supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, compost, and seeds, among other things in order to have good harvests.  This way he will be able to get better earnings in order to be able to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, compost, and seeds, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Sara Y Alma Group

texts.es: El dúo Sara y Alma, está formado por doña María Elena, quien se dedica a la siembra y venta de flores en San Pedro Sacatepéquez y la ciudad de Guatemala, también hace algunas entregas en San Juan Sacatepéquez a las vendedoras del mercado,  Varios pedidos le han hecho pero no le alcanza la siembra que tiene, Por tal motivo necesita nuevamente hacer otro crédito para no fallarles a los clientes, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de semilla y abono para el cultivo de flores.
texts.en: Maria Elena is a member of the communal bank "Sara y Alma."  She has a business growing and selling flowers in San Pedro Sacatepéquez and in the City of Guatemala.  She also makes some deliveries to the sellers in the market in San Juan Sacatepéquez.  She has a lot of orders, but she can't fill them with the flowers she has.  For this reason, she needs another loan so she won't let down her customers.  She is requesting this loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to cultivate flowers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to cultivate flowers

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1994, and she lives in Dong Anh. She is a hospitality management major at Hanoi Tourism college (http://www.htc.edu.vn); she has a passion for this study. Her course lasts three years, and she will graduate in 2015. Thuy’s family has four members, and she is the first person in her family who has studied at college. 

Her parents grow rice, and have a beverage store to earn a living. Her family’s income is about 9,000,000 VND. Her mother is Huong, who sits next to her in this picture; she is also a member of SEDA’s credit program.   

Thuy understands consistent learning gives her the knowledge and opportunities to get a high paying job. 

She wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay her education fee. Besides lacking the education fee, she has other difficulties such as her living costs and transportation fees. 

She wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world whose have contributed to this kind of program. This has been supportive to a lot of her personal education and of Vietnamese’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Orjah Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Orjah” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 400,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Elizabeth is the featured leader of this group. The 26-year-old is married to a diamond miner and the couple has three children of whom two are attending primary schools. Elizabeth has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells market food – palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), peppers, etc. With her share of this loan, Elizabeth will buy the above-mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), peppers, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline Jeaneth

texts.es: Jaqueline de 33 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace 2 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. jaqueline solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Jaqueline, 33, lives with her husband and child.  She's had a beauty salon business for 2 years.  Her business is located in her house, and she works there from 9am until 7pm.  She has a lot of customers because she does very good work.  With the earnings she gets, and with the help of her husband, the couple is able to cover the household expenses.  

Jaqueline is requesting a loan to buy products for her beauty salon such as: creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other items that she needs.  This way she will be able to generate more earnings, which will help her to have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other items

loans.name: Rudy Ernesto

texts.es: Rudy de 32 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Es un hombre luchador. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para él es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito y comprar los principales insumos agrícolas como abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rudy is 32 years old and makes a living farming corn and beans. He is a very hardworking, honorable and responsible man, and his farming operation is his only source of income and livelihood. Even though he lives in very challenging conditions, Rudy never tires of working and always does everything he can to provide for his family. His family means a great deal to him, and they are his inspiration to continue working hard every day.

With the support from this loan, Rudy plans to purchase agricultural input items for tending his crops, including: manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizer, etc. He hopes that this investment will help him to put food on the table by strengthening his farming operation and yielding a plentiful harvest, since his crops are his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Business Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Business” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of SLL 2,500,000 in order to expand their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isatu, a 36-year-old. She was born in Sefadu, near the city of Koidu. Currently, she lives in Koidu with her husband, who is a driver. The couple's two children attend primary and secondary schools respectively. 

For nine years now,  Isatu has been selling palm oil (the country’s No. 1 cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. With this loan, Isatu will buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her business stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa', which can be chewed like tobacco. She has three children and has been doing farm work for twelve years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Managing herself and being able to make a living.' Her biggest challenges are pests and diseases.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Jomo.'

Janet was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Convenience in disbursement and a flexible payment period.'  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That I can achieve my target if I take the loan with the right mindset.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Janet replied, 'their living standards will improve.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Janet owns 'cows and poultry' but does not own 'pigs, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV, and DVD' but does not have 'electricity or a sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has 1 child and has been doing this work for 5 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops in his personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "feeding my animals." His biggest challenge is "getting dairy feed." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "friti."

Jonathan was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "training programmes."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session, and answered, "group guarantee."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Jonathan replied, "I can buy more animals."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jonathan owns the following: "cow, poultry, bicycle" but does not own "pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, solar power, TV" but does not have "electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Peaceful Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Peaceful” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Adama. Adama was born in Kombayinde, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a farmer and has three children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Adama has been a businesswoman for four years now. She sells market-food items like tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of tomatoes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of tomatoes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Blessing Iii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Blessing III” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Safea is the featured leader of this group. Safea is 49-year-old, he is married with 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Safea sells cloths and building materials. He has been a businessman for 12 years now.  He has requested this loan in order to expand his business inventory. He will use this loan to buy more cloths and building materials to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy more cloths and building materials to add to his current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Reselia

texts.pt:
A Senhora Resélia é solteira, possui 5 filhos e desses só vive com 2, que a ajudam nos negócios e os restantes 3 estudam a mais de 30 km de casa num centro internato. A base do seu sustento é o seu negócio de venda de loiças e cobertores na sua própria casa. Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar bacias e mantas para revender. 
As suas maiores esperanças e sonhos são a construção de uma loja para vender seus produtos e uma casa de blocos, pois neste momento vive numa casa de chapas de zinco.
Seu maior desafio é trabalhar mais e diversificar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Resélia is single and has five children. She only lives with two of her children, who help her in her business. The other three attend a boarding school over 30 kilometers away from home.
Her means of livelihood is her business of selling crockery and blankets from home. She will use the loan to purchase bowls and quilts for re-selling.
Her biggest hopes and dreams are building a store in order to sell her merchandise and also building a brick house, since at the moment she lives in a house made of metal sheets.
Her main challenge is working harder and diversifying her business.

loans.use: to purchase bowls and quilts for re-selling.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Mamie. She is married and has two children, aged 23 and 20 years. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.

In 1991, Mamie established her palm oil and motorbike services business. She began her business because she did not go to school. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mamie has already received and successfully repaid her first loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase drums of palm oil. 

In the future, Mamie plans to build more houses. The plan to build more houses was not accomplished, but she succeeded in buying more drums of palm oil, and she also paid her children’s school fees. She is still planning to build houses and also stores for commercial use.  She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drums of palm oil.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Farming is a way of life and a family tradition for Gerardo. His father farmed South Texas land. Gerardo ventured off to try other work, but came back to the family business. While Gerardo’s father worked for other farmers, Gerardo wanted to be his own boss. 

“I had a little money saved up and I started buying equipment little by little,” Gerardo said. “Every year, I would get equipment and make payments on my equipment. It’s been a struggle in the past few years, though.” 

To sustain his family and himself, Gerardo works full-time in an office, but he farms when he’s not working in the office. Gerardo currently has a crop of alfalfa. In the past, he grew livestock grass. And before the drought, one of his most profitable crops was chili peppers.  

At the start of the recession, Gerardo did well investing in a versatile and powerful John Deere tractor that could plow, chisel and level land. Small farmers passing by his 52-acre plot saw him leveling land with ease and asked him to do the same with their land. There were so many requests that leveling land became a significant source of income for his company, A. Custom Work. 

But when Texas got hit with the worst single year drought in history in 2011, Gerardo said as land in South Texas cracked and parched up, his business dried up too. And when the drought continued in 2012 and was sustained through 2013, Gerardo said he faced losing his tractor.
 
While attending a workshop with the Texas A&M AgriLife Extension in El Paso, Gerardo met a loan officer from Accion Texas Inc., who advised him on how to refinance the loan into smaller more affordable payments. Using his John Deere swather as collateral, Gerardo obtained a $5,625 loan from Accion to pay off his tractor.

“I probably would have lost my tractor if I hadn’t gotten this loan from Accion Texas,” Gerardo said. 

Gerardo is toughing out the drought because farming is a way of life and a family tradition. When the drought clears up, he hopes to start growing chili again.

“My plan is to learn ways to improve myself,” Gerardo said. “We are all hoping the water situation improves, too.”

loans.use: to pay off his tractor.

loans.name: Lusério

texts.pt:
O Sr. Lusério reside no Distrito de Boane a 30 km de Maputo Cidade, é pai de 2 filhos menores e vive na base de receitas de vendas de blocos.
Ele precisa do empréstimo para comprar cimento, areia e pó de pedra para o fabrico de blocos para vender.
O seu maior sonho é tornar se o maior fornecedor de blocos na sua região, porém depara se com o desafio de insuficiência de mercado para colocar o seu produto.
texts.en:
Lusério lives in the district of Boane, 30 kilometers from the town of Maputo. He has two underage children and earns a living by selling bricks.
He needs the loan so he can purchase cement, sand and rock dust in order to manufacture bricks for selling.
His biggest dream is becoming the largest brick supplier in his area. However, he faces the challenge of a market that's insufficient for placing his product.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and rock dust in order to manufacture bricks for selling.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Señor De Los Milagros” está constituida por 07 mujeres emprendedoras  y dinámicas, siendo la gran  mayoría de ellas  vecinas de la zona. Este es el caso de Hilda de 47 años casada y con 02 hijos independientes. Hilda comenzó realizando tejidos, poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos. Es así como decide iniciar su propio negocio, donde actualmente ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación Hilda a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y mejorar su vivienda. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente y seguir implementando su negocio. Con los deseos de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito la cual comprará víveres como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y bebidas. El grupo “Señor De Los Milagros” agradecen el crédito brindado. Hilda está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste chaleco rojo y polo a rayas.
texts.en: The Community Alliance "Señor De Los Milagros” (Our Lord of Miracles) consists of 7 dynamic and enterprising women, the majority of whom are neighbors. Hilda is 47 years old, married, with 2 grown children. Hilda began making weavings, little by little growing her income. So she decided to start her own business, where today she sells basic need goods.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication Hilda has been able to support her children in their education and improve their quality of life. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals and to continue growing her business. With the wishes to improve her business she sought a loan in order to buy basic items such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and beverages. The "Señor De Los Milagros” group is thankful for the provided loan. Hilda is located in the back section of the photo, second from the left, dressed in a red vest and striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles and beverages.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
A loan of $8,550 helps Eduardo to increase inventory to offer a wider range of merchandise to his customers. 

Born and raised in Buenos Aires, Argentina, Eduardo began learning about the jewelry industry in his teenage years. First, he worked as an apprentice and then moved to work in a production line for a local manufacturer. When he moved to the U.S. 25 years ago, he continued to pursue his passion for jewelry design and reports by working for several jewelry factories. While he originally operated a jewelry business in a storefront, in 2012 he decided to register as a sole proprietor to begin his business in an existing space, World of Watches, a jewelry store located in a busy shopping plaza in Las Vegas. Eduardo’s main focus is on selling and repairing jewelry. The success of his business is due to his ability to provide outstanding customer service by finding and designing jewelry pieces unique to clients' requests. 

Eduardo’s vision for the future is multifaceted: personally, he wants to create a better life for his family and to leave a successful business for his two children to take over. From a business standpoint, he aspires to become a known, respected, and honest jeweler, not only among peers, but also within his community.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
A loan of $6,950 will help Adam upgrade his equipment. He plans on purchasing a new hard drive for an iMac and a 16-35 mm “L” lens as well as a fish eye lens. 

Adam is a second generation American, third generation business owner, and father of two young sons. Following his graduation from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts in Film Production, he started Sharpshooter Pictures, a NY-based award winning Production Company that creates premium video and still photography for Fortune 500 companies. His clients include About.com, ABC Television, Groupon, Seamless, Jennifer Hudson, Forbes, The Hartford, Yahoo, among others. 

In the aftermath of hurricane Sandy, Adam felt compelled to help and he did so by making two pro bono videos for Friends of Firefighters. This was used as a fundraising tool to help residents of Breezy Point. 

To check out his work and and learn more about Adam’s production company, please visit www.sharpshooterpictures.com.

loans.use: to upgrade equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional live bait, fishing poles, and snacks for her customers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
A loan of $9,150 helps Luis to purchase printing equipment and cover installation, delivery, and maintenance costs. With his new offset printing press, he can widen the range of services he offers to customers. 

After nearly 28 years of working in the printing business, including in his native Dominican Republic, Luis decided it was time to follow his passion by independently operating his own business. As the owner of Lewis Graphic Services, he designs and prints books, brochures, letterheads, etc. Luis prides himself on excellent customer service and satisfaction. 

Luis has received one previous loan from Accion East and Online, which he has made steady payments on and is now refinancing.

loans.use: to purchase additional printing equipment to increase range of services

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
A loan of $3,225 helps Andres to purchase additional massage tables and to make minor renovations to his new business space. He is hiring an additional staff member and relocating to a larger space to help accommodate an increased demand for services after a successful campaign with Google Deals and Living Social. 

His business, JP’s Massage Therapy, previously operated out of a one-room shared space with no parking. He has selected a space that was previously a massage studio and is well-suited to his needs in that it will not be shared and has enough room and increased visibility. 

While Andres envisions a future in which he would be able to work 100% of the time at his own business, he currently works for a school during the work week. He devotes his evenings and weekends to JP’s Massage Therapy Center. Andres adds to his vision by stating he hopes his business, one day, will have multiple employees and multiple locations throughout the Boston area. 

More details on his massage therapy center can be found at www.jpsmassage.com.

loans.use: to purchase massage equipment and renovate his new business space

loans.name: Billie

texts.en:
Forevergreen Counseling Ministries is an educational ministry that preaches the word of God on Sundays and completes ministry work Monday through Saturday. 

Owned by Billie, a devoted 54-year-old woman, the ministry offers a range of services. As Billie tells it, the ministry is a vessel to educate children, offer marriage counseling, and help others daily. 

Along with her team, Billie tries to attend as many conventions to help improve her ministry when possible and conducts most of her service work outside the ministry. To enhance the amount of people Billie reaches through the ministry, she reached to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan; $4,375 paid for a car for one of her team members, which will also allow for transporting students to and from school. “They’re helping us to help other people,” she says.

Billie says the amount of work she is doing now, is only half of what is in store for Forevergreen. She began a youth program YOU, Youth Org United, which she plans to continue, and writes and sings songs and is ready to produce a CD to promote God through the power of music. 

She said to the Accion staff, “Thanks for helping me.”

loans.use: to buy a car for one of her team members, which will also allow for transporting students to and from school.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado con cinco socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Linda mujer de 21 años, casada con un hijo de dos años, su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio, desde hace 18 meses, anteriormente era estudiante lo que se casa y abre su negocio  para aportar al gasto de su familia, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, crema acida, leches en bolsa, mantequilla, pan, pan dulce, carne de res, carne de pollo  etc. Marling tiene 30 años de edad su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio, Elena tiene 55 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortilla, María Mercedes tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, y Francisca tiene 50 años de edad su negocio es la venta de perfumen y venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group consists of five successful, enterprising members, one of whom is Linda. She is 21 years old, married with a two year old son, and her business is a small grocery store in her home that she has had for 18 months. Previously she was a student and she opened her business to support her family's expenses. The loan will be used to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, sour cream, bagged milk, butter, bread, sweet bread, beef, chicken, etc. Marling is 30 years old, her business is selling food from her home. Elenta is 55 years old, her business is selling tortillas. María Mercedes is 23 years old, her business is selling new clothing. Francisca is 50 years old, her business is selling perfume and new clothing.

loans.use: to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, sour cream, bagged milk, butter, bread, sweet bread, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has four children, aged 32, 30, 28 and 22 years. 

In 2006, Fatmata established her baby clothing business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in some responsibilities. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more Pampers, baby oil, powder, etc. for resale. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to develop and to build a shop on her own and also educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more Pampers, baby oil, powder, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
A Senhora Sónia é solteira e tem 2 filhos, 1 dele menor e outro frequentando o ensino Secundário a 10Km da sua casa.
Ela é modista e estilista. Tem um atelier em Boane, onde faz costura de roupas e vende. Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar tecidos para fabrico de roupas.
Para além disto, a Senhora Sónia ensina adolescentes e adultos a costurar, organizando formações de 45 dias no seu atelier, o que lhe permite ter um rendimento extra.
Seu maior sonho é ter um reconhecimento internacional no mundo da moda e poder expor as suas obras com estilistas de todo mundo. No entanto, depara-se com algumas dificuldades em encontrar mercado e falta de recursos para promover o seu trabalho.
texts.en:
Sónia is single and has two children. One of her children is underage and the other one attends high school 10 kilometers away from home.
She's a dressmaker and a designer. She owns a shop in Boane where she sews and sells clothing. She'll use the loan to purchase fabric in order to make clothing.
Aside from that, Sónia teaches teenagers and adults to sew by organizing 45-day courses in her shop. This allows her to earn extra income.
Her biggest dream is to be internationally recognized in the fashion world and to be able to showcase her creations alongside designers from all over the world. However, she faces some difficulties such as finding a market and lacking resources for promoting her work.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in order to make clothing in her shop.

loans.name: Henriqueta

texts.pt:
A Senhora Henriqueta vive em Boane. É solteira e tem 2 filhos ambos frequentando o ensino secundário longe de casa.
A sua base de sustento é o negócio. Ela é negociante de roupas usadas, que adquire a 30Km da sua casa e revende no mercado local. Além disto, em sua casa cria galinhas poedeiras e vende ovos.
A Senhora Henriqueta irá aplicar o empréstimo na compra de fardos de roupas usadas (calças e bolsas) para revender.
Ela gostaria de terminar a sua casa e aumentar o tamanho da sua capoeira de modo a aumentar o número de galinhas poedeiras.
Sua maior dificuldade é conseguir espaço para exercer as suas actividades.
texts.en:
Henriqueta lives in Boane. She's single and has two children, both of whom attend high school away from home.
Her means of livelihood is her business. She trades used clothing, which she buys 30 kilometers away from her home and then re-sells at the local market. Besides, she raises laying hens in her house and sells eggs.
Henriqueta will use the loan to purchase bundles of used clothing (trousers and bags) for re-selling.
She would like to finish her house and enlarge her coop in order to increase the number of laying hens.
Her biggest difficulty is getting enough space for carrying out her business activities.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing (trousers and bags) for re-selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 41year-old Isatu.  She is married and has 5 children aged 20,16,13,11 and 8. In 2006, Isatu established her Jewelries business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in solving some domestic home problems. Her business is located in City Center and her main customers are Women. Working 7 days a week and 9hrs  a day, she earns about Le800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more jewelries such as hair weaves and earrings for resale.. In the future, Isatu plans to become an international business woman and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy items such as hair weaves and earrings for resale

loans.name: Maryin Elieth

texts.es: Maryin, es una joven de 27 años de edad, habita en el barrio 30 de Mayo, tiene una hija de 8 años que estudia en el colegio del barrio, ella es madre soltera; en la vida le ha tocado trabajar arduamente ya que solamente logro cursar el tercer grado de primaria, hoy en día se dedica a la venta de cabeza de cerdo, también hace sopa, repochetas, vigoron y refrescos; platillos típicos del país, para continuar haciendo las ventas del día solicita el crédito para bastecerse de materia prima.
texts.en: Maryin is 27 years old and lives in the 30 de Mayo neighborhood. She has an 8 year old daughter in the neighborhood school. Maryin is a single mother. She has had to work hard in her life as she only finished 3rd grade in elementary school. Today she dedicates herself to selling pork, she also makes soup, repochetas (similar to tacos), vigarones (cabbage salad, boiled yuca, and chicharrones wrapped in plantain leaves) and beverages, which are typical dishes of her country. In order to continue selling daily she is seeking a loan to stock up on ingredients.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
O Senhor Fernando é residente em Boane, vive maritalmente há mais de 5 anos e tem 3 filhos menores, sendo que o mais velho tem 8 anos e possui uma deficiência física. Cuida também da sua irmã mais nova, também possuidora de deficiência. Ele trabalha como professor primário a 40Km da sua casa.
Pretende usar o empréstimo para comprar uma porta, 2 janelas, 20 sacos de cimento, pagar o transporte destes materiais e a mão-de-obra, para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
Seu maior sonho é de construir uma barraca para a sua esposa, que neste momento se encontra desempregada, poder abrir um negócio. Ele sonha também em dar continuidade aos seus estudos superiores, que interrompeu por não conseguir compatibilizar com o seu horário de trabalho.
Seu maior desafio e conseguir juntar dinheiro para financiar os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in Boane. He has been in a common law marriage for over five years and has three underage children. The eldest of his children is 8 years old and handicapped. He also takes care of his younger sister, who's also handicapped. He works as an elementary school teacher 40 kilometers away from his home.
He intends to use the loan to purchase a door, two windows and 20 sacks of cement, and to pay for labor and for transportation of these supplies in order to continue building his house.
His biggest dream is to build a booth so that his wife who's currently unemployed can start a business. He also dreams of moving forward with his college studies, which he interrupted because he couldn't reconcile them with his work schedule.
His biggest challenge is being able to save money to pay for his studies.

loans.use: to purchase a door, two windows and 20 sacks of cement, and to pay for labor and for transportation of these supplies in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Joel Estanislao

texts.es:
Joel es un hombre de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que el siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven Joel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Electricidad que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Joel trabaja como buzo artesanal en embarcaciones pesqueras de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Joel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de su hijo mejor, ya que desea comprarle libros, cuadernos y otros útiles escolares que necesita, ya que él se encuentra cursando su formación primaria, así pues Joel seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joel is a 51 year old man.  He lives in the city of Chincha with his three children.  He loves his children and they are his main reason for living.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. Joel dedicates all of his efforts to get his family ahead because he has always been both father and mother to his children.  Regrettably, due to lack of finances and the need to start working at a very young age, Joel couldn’t study for the degree in electricity that he wanted.  In his free time, he enjoys playing with his children and sometimes cooks a delicious “Ceviche” [marinated raw fish or shellfish] to share with his family.

By his own initiative, and with much determination and dedication, Joel works as an artisanal diver on fishing vessels in the city.  He works every day for about ten hours and believes that it is going well because of his experience and the kind way he treats others.

Joel is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to their support, he will be able to pay for his oldest son’s educational expenses.  He wants to buy him books, notebooks, and other school supplies that he needs since he is completing his primary education.  Joel will continue working and striving to achieve his greatest dream of providing his children with a good education.

loans.use: to pay for his oldest son's educational expenses.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es: Don jose de 45 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos y asi podrá darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose, 45, is a man who is very responsible with his household responsibilities.  He has always been known for providing the best for his family.  He lives with his wife and children.  He is very hardworking, and always works with cheer and enthusiasm.  He is a farmer, and every year he cultivates the staple grains of the region, such as corn and beans.  

Jose wants to increase his sales, and so this is why he visited the offices of INTEGRAL to request a loan.  This loan will allow him to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies.  He wants to rely on this financial assistance because he has no other income, and this will enable him to provide his family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: Doña maria de 50 años de edad desde hace 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografía, con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Ella quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Doña María, 50 years old, has been farming for ten years and this is her principal source of income. She cultivates corn and beans and when her crops are ready she stores them in large sacks as shown in the photograph. With her earnings from the harvest, she is able to pay some of her household expenses. 

She wants to buy the supplies necessary for her crops, such as compost, fertilizer, seeds, etc., however since she lacks the financial resources for such an investment she has decided to apply for a loan; this is the only way she can continue to farm. Like all farmers she puts her faith in farming because she has no other source of income. Moreover she wants to excel by doing the best she can for her crops. She hopes to have an abundant harvest that will enable her to continue putting bread on the table every day, while repaying her loan.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Yafane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yafane âgé de 45 ans, s’active dans l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Il fait de l’embouche bovine et reste actif durant toute la journée. Il vient solliciter un crédit de 500000F CFA  pour  l’achat de cinq bœufs qu’il va emboucher pour revendre dans les marchés locaux. 
Yafane est marié et père de famille. Il s’occupe des charges familiales et veille à ce que les membres de sa famille soient dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
Yafane nourrit un projet qui lui tient à cœur : c’est-à-dire celui d’avoir une ferme où il pourra élever aussi bien des bœufs, des moutons, des chèvres que des poulets.
texts.en:
Yafane is 45 years old and he has been actively involved in raising livestock for more than 10 years.  He fattens cows and he is very active throughout the day.  He is requesting a loan of 500,000 CFA francs to buy five oxen which he will fatten and then resell at local markets.

Yafane is married and he has a family.  He takes care of his family's expenses and makes sure that his family members enjoy good living conditions.

Yafane would very much like to see his future project become a reality: he would like to have a farm where he could raise oxen, sheep, goats and chickens.

loans.use: to buy five oxen to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo, en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cultivos, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el cliente necesita invertir en sus siembras por eso  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. el cliente  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives with his life’s companion and their son in their own house. He cultivates corn and beans and has spent several years working as a farmer. That has given him a great deal of experience and enables him to have the best crops. He sells his harvests in surrounding areas and has many customers who prefer him because of the quality and good prices of his crops and above all because of his good service. 

The client needs to invest in his fields and is applying for a loan that will permit him to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc. He has good references for loan re-payment from his acquaintances and he is very responsible. He claims that he will be able to pay off the debt within the established time frame and he is also confident that the funding will provide his household with economic security.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles Polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Nerekoro dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments, d’échalotes, de la patate, du melon etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata  (2ème femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs d’échalote et de la patate. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The seven women who make up the Djiguisseme group are mostly married in polygamous families.  On average, they are 39 years old and have three children each. They all live in the village of Nerekoro, near Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and they know one another through neighborhood, marriage and family ties. They are involved in small retail business, selling condiments, shallots, potatoes, melons etc.

They have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses, and they are on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Aminata, standing second from the right in the photo, is well-known as an important seller of various condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy five bags of shallots and some potatoes. She resells her goods from home, for cash or on credit, to a customer base which mostly consists of women.

With this loan, Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business and also used to buy condiments for her household.

loans.use: to buy shallots and potatoes.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria tiene  48 años, esta casada y vive en una casa construida a base de adobe junto a sus 4 hijos. 
Apolinaria se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo desde hace 20 años y su trabajo es mantener en buen estado las plantaciones de cacao y otras plantas que poseen ya que son el principal sustento económico.
Se inició con ayuda de sus padres quienes le cedieron un terreno agrícola para ganar dinero y solucionar los gastos de su familia porque ya tenían un hijo en aquel entonces.
Para mejorar sus ganancias trata de mantener sus terrenos limpios de maleza y fertiliza constantemente sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico.Cuando el trabajo es demasiado pesado contrata trabajadores del lugar a quienes paga por adelantado y solo así puede terminar a tiempo las distintas tareas agrícolas.
Vende las cosechas que obtiene a los compradores del su localidad quienes le pagan un precio de acuerdo a la calidad en que se encuentran sus productos y eso le permite recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales.Este su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su negocio.En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para  comprar  abono orgánico y así nutrir a sus sembríos.
texts.en: Apolinaria is 48 years old, married, and lives in an adobe house with her 4 children. Apolinaria and her husband have been farming for 20 years and their work focuses on maintain in good condition cocoa plantations and other plants that they own as these plants are their economic basis. She began with the help of her parents who gave her some farmland to earn money and help with family expenses because she and her husband had a child at that time. In order to improve her earnings she tries to keep her lands clean from pestilence and constantly fertilizes her farmland with organic fertilizer. When the work is very hard she contracts with workers who she pays to complete distinct agricultural tasks. She sells the crops she obtains to buyers in her area who pay an agreed-upon price depending on the quality of her products. This permits her to recoup the money that she invested with her additional earnings. this is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she receives in order to continue with her business. With this loan she seeks 2000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizers and in this way feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata, une dame de la quarantaine, s’active dans la vente de poissons frais. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Chaque matin, elle démarre sa journée à 9h et fini à 19h du soir. Elle n’a besoin que de 50000F CFA pour acheter une caisse de poissons frais et avoir un fond de roulement.
Aminata est veuve et mère de famille, elle a la charge de ses enfants mais reçois aussi l’appui de ses frères pour mettre ses enfants dans de bonnes conditions.
Avec les bénéfices, elle réussi à épargner régulièrement et à augmenter son fond de roulement pour  hausser son offre.
texts.en:
Aminata is in her forties and she is actively involved in the sale of fresh fish.  She has more than ten years of experience in this field.  She starts work every morning at 9AM and ends at 7PM.  She only needs 50,000 CFA francs to buy one crate of fresh fish and to build some working capital.

Aminata is a widow with a family to raise.  Although she takes care of her children, she also receives some support from her brothers, which allows her to provide good living conditions for her children.

With her profits, she manages to regularly save some money and to increase her working capital and her supply of goods.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale at the local markets.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Princess. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 6. In 1998, Princess established her garie, flour and ground nut business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband and family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are all classes of people. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Princess requires a loan in order to purchase more garie, flour and ground nut for resale. In the future, Princess plans to build a house and to give her children quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more garie, flour and ground nut for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, chicken, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil, corn and beans for resale.

loans.name: Taslime

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Teslime. He is married and has one child, aged 15. In 2007, Teslime established his plastic bowls, buckets, cups, etc., business. He began this business because he was not educated, so he wanted to help himself. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are all classes of people. Working seven days a week and 18 hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Teslime requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic bowls, cups, etc. In the future, Teslime plans to construct a bakery as a means of generating more income. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, cups, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariama. She is married, and has two children aged 10 and 8. In 1992, Mariama established her oil, salt, onion, etc., business. She began this business because she wanted to help her husband and family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women, children and men. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase oil, salt, onion, etc., for resale. In the future, Mariama plans to educate her children up to the university level, and also to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase oil, salt, onion for resale.

loans.name: Djantoyerela I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxieme prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  WASA , 2 eme assie de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 40.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the DJANTOYERELA I group are married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. 

The featured borrower, Wasa, grows rice. In the photo, she is in the sitting row, second from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Sanankoroba market.

Wasa is expecting to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing and to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista Group

texts.es: La señora Marta Lucrecia, de 42 años de edad y se dedica al bordado de blusas típicas a máquina, y a la elaboración de delantales actual mente Tiene varias blusas que bordar pero el hilo que tiene no le alcanza y necesita comprar más cajas de hilos en varios colores para poder completar el pedido de sus clientes. Por eso ella necesita más capital y así poder seguir trabajando,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion en bordados de blusas.
texts.en: Marta Lucrecia, 42 years old, works embroidering traditional blouses by machine and making aprons. Right now she has several blouses to embroider but she does not have enough thread and she needs to buy more boxes of thread in various colors in order to be able to complete her customers' orders. For this reason she needs more resources and so in order to continue working she is seeking this loan in order to buy raw material for the embroidery of blouses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the embroidery of blouses

loans.name: Ballay

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Ballay. She is married and has three children, aged 30, 25 and 18 years. In 1987, Ballay established her business, selling groundnuts and oil. She began her business, because she wants a better living with her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Ballay requires a loan in order to purchase more groundnuts and oil for resale. In the future, Ballay plans to educate her son up to university and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to puchase more groundnuts and oil for resale

loans.name: Mame Mbissine

texts.fr: Madame Mame Mbissine vit au Sénégal avec sa famille. Elle est mariée et  s’active dans le secteur du commerce. En effet elle  vient juste de débuter une activité commerciale de  vente de sacs et de chaussures. Elle est membre  de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un prêt de 500 000 prévu pour   l’achat  de marchandises a vendre dans le but de développer son activité de commerce. Son vœu est de  diversifier davantage les marchandises qu’elle commercialise dans l’intention de satisfaire les désirs de sa clientèle. Ce financement pourrait l’aider a améliorer ses gains financiers ce qui lui permettra de d’améliorer le niveau de ses économies et de mieux faire face aux dépenses imprévues. Son projet  dans le futur est d’élargir son activité jusqu'à  parvenir a employer  un personnel.
texts.en:
Mame Mbisssine lives in Senegal with her family.  She is married and actively involved in retail, having just started selling bags and shoes.  She is a client of the UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy some goods that she will resell in order to develop her business.

Mame Mbissine would like to further diversify the goods that she sells in order to meet her customers' expectations.

This loan may help her to increase her earnings, which will in turn help her to save more money and to be better prepared in case of unforeseeable expenses.  In the future she would like to expand her activity to the point where she can hire one employee.

loans.use: to buy some bags, shoes and other various retail goods.

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Amidu. He is married, and he has two children, aged 5 and 3 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him as works as a sales assistant.  In 1997 Amidu established his business, selling foods like rice and beans. He began his business, because he wants to live a better life. His business is located in the outskirts of town, and his main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Amidu requires a loan in order to buy more foods for resale, including rice and beans. In the future, Amidu plans to build a house and to start another shop, which his wife will manage. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Sento

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Sento. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 8 years. In 2007 Sento established her grocery shop. She began her business, because she wants to assist her husband in supporting the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her customers are all kinds of people. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business.
