This is the first microloan for Sam with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to buy gasoline for carrying water into her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman and a mother of two children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Rebecca has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than eight years now. This is the source of her income. 

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, paint, nails and others. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his fishing business and augment his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, paint, nails and others

loans.name: Djiguignouma I Group

texts.fr:
Les  9 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  MAIMOUNA , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Djuguignouma I group are married woman. On the average, they are 42 years of age, with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, a village in Sanankoroboa, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with this institution, having duly repaid their prior loans.

They grow peanuts, which is what Maimouna does, for example, She is the first one standing on the left in the photo. With this loan, She plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and pay the cost of labor to work 0.5 ha [about 1 acre] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village market of Bougoula, to a customer base composed of resellers and consumers. She plans to earn a revenue of 25,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural season. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband provide for everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 46, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Arturo, an employee, and she's a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household as they both work to provide for their everyday needs.

Lilibeth buys and sells charcoal. She buys a big quantity of charcoal and then sells it by the plastic bag or sack. She also sells rice and ice candy for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 550 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. She will also buy sacks of rice. 

Lilibeth dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and an education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more charcoal and sacks of rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Chhreb's Group

texts.en:
Chhreb is aged 34 and married. She has three children, two of whom are still in school. Living in a village of the Moung Russey district, Chhreb farms rice and plants chilies to make a living. Having been in this business for several years, she manages to earn about 24,000 KHR per day to feed her family.
. 
This is the first loan for Chhreb’s group with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes increase her crop yield so as to sell her produce for a good price to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gleceria is 61 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gleceria has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Gleceria requested a PHP 22,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Gleceria has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 57 years old and married, with eight children. With two children currently in school, Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Imelda has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, shampoo, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pacaman Group

texts.es:
El señor Diego Macario es de estado civil soltero, cuenta con 24 años de edad, se dedica al comercio, venta de mercerias, inició este negocio con el apoyo de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería como: ganchos, aretes, pulseras, entre otros, en el futuro muy cercano desea tener un capital amplio y que su negocio prospere día con día; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, artesanía y pecuario.
texts.en:
Diego Macario, age 24, is single.  He sells dry-goods.  He started this business with the support of his parents, and he now has eight years of experience.  He has his family’s support.

He decided to organize a group and request a loan.  He will use the loan to buy goods like hairpins, earrings, and bracelets, among others.  In the near future he wishes to have increased capital, and he wants his business to prosper day to day.

The other members of the group work in commerce, handicrafts, and with livestock.

loans.use: to buy dry-goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for this ransport business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is from Dicoloc, Jimenez. She is 55 years old, widowed, and has three children. 

To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a lumber manufacturing business. Arlene has been engaged in her business for three years. Aside from her business, she also has a farm, planting rice for sale. In 2008, Arlene joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

Arlene is requesting a new loan of PHP 4,500 which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Las Bandidas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Bandidas está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos y todos los turista que viene se enamora por su belleza natural, su arquitectura y su gastronomía. Las socias son mujeres amables que ha diario luchan para mejora la estabilidad de sus hogares, brindándoles un mejor bienestar a todas sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Delia, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus compañeras y amigas del banco comunal Las Bandidas, el banco comunal le gusta por la unión y el compañerismo que existen en el grupo.

Ella tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, tres de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, dos trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, y su último hijo estudia en el colegio y trabaja. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar, su esposo labora a diario como jornalero.

La Señora. Delia trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo en un taller de costura que es de una de sus hijas casadas, en sus tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de ropa, esta actividad la realiza ambulantemente. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa para aumentar su mercadería. 

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The 'Las Bandidas' community bank has seven female members who all live in the city of Cuenca.  This city was declared a World Heritage Site in 1999.  It is bathed by four rivers and all the tourists who visit it fall in love with its natural beauty, architecture and cuisine.  The members of this group are friendly women who work hard every day in order to improve their household stability and their families' well-being.

Delia is a member of this group.  She is taking out her second loan with her fellow group members and friends.  She likes her community bank because of the cohesion and friendship that exists between its members.

Delia is 52 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage.  Three of her children are married and live independently.  Two work and help her out financially and the youngest is both attending school and working.  They do not own their own home but live in a family member's house.  Delia's husband works as a day laborer.

Delia works from Monday to Saturday in a sewing workshop belonging to one of her married daughters.  She does not work fixed hours.  In her free time, she sells clothing.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.

Delia will invest her loan money in buying clothing in order to increase her stock levels.  Her goal is to have her own business premises from which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old and married, with four children.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy food and household goods to sell, like spices, eggs, milk, cream, sugar, and soap.

Maribel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income by raising livestock.

Maribel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy food and household goods to sell like spices, eggs, milk, cream, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional ready-to-wear products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting her personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy ready-to-wear products like ladies' wear, men's wear, kids' wear and other merchandise items to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Criselda dreams to be successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear products like ladies' wear, men's wear, kids' wear, and other merchandise items to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Leon

texts.es: El socio León nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 55  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, él se dedica a la carpintería pero también trabaja para una entidad pública en el área de obras, él requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y otros materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo clavos, pintura y otras cosas más, él está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
León was born in the city of Pilco-Grande, and he lives in the same city where he was born.  He is 55 years old, and he is in a common-law marriage.  He is a carpenter, but he also work for a public entity in construction.

He needs the loan to buy wood and other work materials like nails, paint, and other things.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

(The Pilco-Grande community is located in the Huayllabamba district in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy wood and other work materials like nails, paint, and other things.

loans.name: Aileen's Group

texts.en:
Aileen is 35 years old. She is married and has no children. She lives in Tamban, Pta. Miray, Baliangao. Aileen is engaged in selling snacks and other delicacies. She has been doing this business for a year. She earns a monthly income of 2100 PHP from this activity. Aileen is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase construction materials needed for house repair. Aileen has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.
Aileen is a leader of the three-member group, whose members have different responsibilities towards their respective loans.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Nkondo Tukwatanise Group

texts.en: Annet is the divorced mother of three children. She is 42 years old and earns a living by selling second-hand clothing. She works in various weekly markets, selling to different people who come to the market from various local areas. She wants a loan to buy more used clothing so that she can increase her sales and increase her profits. She will plough the profits back into her business so that she can expand it. Her dream is to build a house for her children so that she doesn't  have to spend most of her profits on rent. She is faced with various challenges, including high transport costs, and sometimes does not earn enough money to meet all of her expenses. She is a hard-working single woman who believes in supporting herself.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a thirty-seven-year-old, hard-working lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling second hand shoes.  With the proceeds from this business she has been able to educate her children.

Her future vision is to buy land for constructing a good home and educating her children to higher levels of education despite inadequate capital.  Christine will use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Louy's Group

texts.en:
Louy is a 59-year-old widowed mother of five children who lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice on a five-hectare area of land for 15 years. The current business earns her about 12,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and she can save about 3,000 KHR each day after expenses. 
Louy has been with VisionFund for five loans while the other member has been with VisionFund for six loans. Louy completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Kotridah

texts.en: Kotridah is 40 years old, married with four children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For 15 years, she has been working as a government employee and with her salary she has educated her children and bought land where she has started constructing a house. Low salary with little or no motivation incentives in her job are her major setbacks while her dreams are to venture into the housing real estate business. Kotridah is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, nails, and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, nails, and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es de estado civil casada, tiene 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 5 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, inició este negocio por la necesidad de superarse económicamente y hasta la fehca lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de cerditos y pollos, tambien concentrado para los mismos, en el futuro desea que su capital crezca y heredarselo a sus hijos, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y agropecuario.
texts.en:
Micaela is married and 57 years old. She did not have the chance to attend school. She has five children, and one of them is going to school. She raises small animals, and started this business because she needed to better herself financially. To date she has 10 years of experience.

She is organizing a group and has decided to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy piglets and chickens as well as feed concentrate. In the future she wishes to see her capital grow and to pass it on to her children. The other members of the group have small businesses, farm, and raise livestock.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chickens.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a thirty-two-year-old, married woman with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She runs a drug shop alongside earning a salary as a medical worker to boost her income.  Her dream is to set up a big drug shop and low pay is her major challenge.  

Being the good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to University level and upgrade their studies.  Leonard will use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals to sell.

loans.name: Malay's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Malay is a 29-year-old, married mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. Raising pigs and selling grocery items have been the main sources of her family’s income for eight years. Malay can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.  She manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Malay has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely repaid all her previous loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Malay, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to fatten her pig so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is married and the mother of three children. She is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the past few years by owning and operating a general store. Laura is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny, 39, is a married woman with two children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jenny has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery stock to sell like biscuits, soft drinks, candies, noodles and cream for her general store.

Jenny has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jenny would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock to sell like biscuits, soft drinks, candies, noodles and cream for her general store

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a small restaurant. She has been running a beauty parlor for the past twelve years. She has gotten a lot of appreciation through her work. She is very talented and knows the art of make-up very well. People prefer her for bridal makeup. She is facing financial issues as her husband's and her net income is inadequate to cover the household needs.

Due to an increase in the number of customers, she requires more beauty products, utensils, and some furniture to cater to many customers at a time. For this, she requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to meet the requirements of her parlor, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. 

With the profits expected from this loan, she intends to purchase furniture for her husband's business and to save some money for their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products, utensils, and some furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a twenty-six-year-old married man with one child living in Kagadi, Uganda. For the past four years he has been a primary school head teacher and also practices agriculture to supplement his income. He faces a challenge of being paid a low salary and his plan is to start a business that can help him meet his family's basic needs.

Edson will use the loan to buy mirrors, a screen and shaving machines to start up a barber shop.

loans.use: buy mirrors, a screen and shaving machines to start up a  barber shop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is 44 years old and she is happily married to Pablo who works as a taxi driver. God has blessed them with two loving children and both of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Virginia owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, aPhp5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and others. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then she sells them per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns Php 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of Php 15,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her in adding more products to her store.

Virginia hopes that her business will expand and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a thirty-year-old married lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is running a restaurant so as to earn a living and look after her children. She has a vision of expanding her business to a big pork joint despite facing a challenge of increased competition. Sandra is requesting a loan to buy a fridge and food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and food  for the restaurant.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una socia muy activa que forma parte del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, le gusta el banco comunal ya que los créditos le permiten mejorar sus cultivos y también comprar mas animales. Vive por la parroquia de Nabon en Cuenca, lugar que tiene clima frió y está rodeado de exuberante vegetación gracias a su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente aun mantienen vivas sus tradiciones.

La Señora. María tiene 31 años, es casada en su unión conyugal a concebido 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña María pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son pequeños, para aportar a la economía de su casa trabaja en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las que vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad, también cría pollos cerdos y cuyes.

El dinero de su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos, semillas y abono.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a very active member of the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada community bank.  She likes the community bank because the loans allow her to improve her crops and buy more animals.  María lives in Nabon parish, in Cuenca.  This is a cold climate area which is surrounded by lush vegetation thanks to its hilly geography.  The area's architecture is a mixture of old and modern and the locals keep their traditions alive.

María is 31 years old, married, and has three children who are 6, 4 and 2 years old.  Her eldest son attends an elementary school in the town.  Her husband works as a day laborer.  They own the house in which they live.

María spends most of her time at home caring for her children who are still young.  In order to contribute financially towards the household she works as a farmer, growing vegetables that she sells in her community or in the city.  She also raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.

María will invest her loan money in buying pigs, chickens, seeds and compost.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, seeds and compost

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 42, lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province and he is married with four children, one of whom is dependent on him and still in school. The family’s main sources of income are from farming rice and planting cassava. He also supplements the income by working for others for a fee. He has been in this business for 19 years.  He is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. Low crop yield is still a main challenge for the family’s business. 

Tha has only just joined VisionFund, this cycle. Now he is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. With this loan, he is going to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to make more income so as to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.en:
To achieve her goal, Claudia has enrolled in Escuela Militar De Ingeniería (Emi). She expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return.

Claudia shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a loan, Claudia plans on using the funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. Claudia currently works 40 hours a week. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, she expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling Claudia is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. 

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fee

loans.name: Alba Esther

texts.es:
La cliente Alba vive en el sector de las Orquídeas. Comenzó con su negocio cuando vio que su familia necesitaba mas ingresos. Comenzó vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo, poco a poco fue mejorando sus ventas. Incrementando su mercadería con perfumes, ropa mejoro su cliente. 

En la actualidad trabaja con pedidos de cosméticos, ropa, perfumes que le hacen los clientes. Los productos los deja a créditos. Trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 17:00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio porque tiene 1 hijo de 13 años que aun esta estudiando. 

Con el prestamo quiere variar su mercadería comprando perfumes, cremas, cosméticos etc. En el futuro quiere tener su casa construida al 100%.
texts.en:
Alba lives in an area known as Las Orquídeas. She started her business when she saw that her family needed more income. Alba began selling cosmetics through catalogs and gradually improved her sales. She increased her inventory buy adding perfumes and clothing, which improved her clientele.

At the moment, Alba works by taking orders for cosmetics, clothing, and perfumes from her customers. She offers the products on credit. Alba works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has many aspirations for her business because she has a 13-year-old child who is studying.

With this loan, Alba wants to vary her merchandise buy purchasing perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other products. In the future, she wants to have a house that is 100% completed.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria, es una señora que ha pasado dificultades por sus problemas de salud lo que le ha impedido progresar con su negocio de pulpería, estuvo vendiendo lácteos a la par de su esposo quien le ayuda con sus ingresos de la venta, sus hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, doña Gloria desea continuar con el negocio de pulpería por lo que solicita el préstamo para invertir con mas productos para garantizar el sustento diario del hogar, ella como todo Nicaragüense busca como salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en: Gloria has experienced health problems which have made it difficult for her to progress with her business of running a convenience store. She was selling dairy products alongside her husband, who helps provide an income. Her children are all independent adults. Gloria wants to continue with her convenience store business, so is asking for a loan to invest in more products to guarantee daily support for her home. Like all Nicaraguans, she is looking for a way to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, dairy products, sweets and meat products, among other items.

loans.name: Loey's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Loey is aged 60 years and married. He has nine children. To support the family, he and his wife have been farming rice for twenty-eight years. The current business earns him about 35,000 KHR per day to meet his family’s needs. 

Loey has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for eight cycles already and he successfully used the past loans to better support his family: to have sufficient food and for his children’s education. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. He is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and gasoline for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to expand his current business to earn a larger income to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline for his farmland

loans.name: Dema

texts.en:
This is Dema. She previously accessed a PHP 15,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Dema would like to apply for another loan in the amount of PHP 16,000 to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The greater the number of items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dema dreams to expand her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Аличон молодой женатый человек в возрасте 22-х лет. Он живет в районе Рудаки с женой, ребенком, родителями, братом и сестрой. Аличон предприимчивый человек. Он намерен заняться собственным бизнесом. Так как сейчас лето и сезон мороженного, он хочет открыть в своем районе летнее кафе, где будет обслуживать посетителей мороженным. Аличон уже нашел и арендовал хорошее место для кафе. Теперь, чтобы открыть кафе и начать свой бизнес, ему необходимо приобрести двух аппаратов мороженного и двух холодильников для мороженного. Для реализации цели он обратился за кредитом. Аличон верит в вашу поддержку. Новый бизнес помог бы ему увеличить и улучшить финансовое состояние семьи.
texts.en: Alijon is a young married man, who is 22 years old.  He lives in the Rudaki district with his wife, child, parents, brother and sister.  Alijon is an entrepreneurial person.  He intends to get involved in his own business.  Because this is summertime and ice-cream season, he wants to open a summer cafe in his district, where he would be serving ice-cream to customers.  Alijon already found and leased a good location for the cafe.  Now, in order to open the cafe and start his business, he needs to purchase two ice-cream making machines and two refrigerators for ice-cream.  He requested this loan to realize his goal.  Alijon believes in your support.  The new business would help him to increase and improve his family's financial condition.

loans.use: to purchase two ice-cream making machines and two refrigerators in order to open a summer cafe

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband owns a garment shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of ready-made dresses for his business so that he can increase his income. Due to a lack of finances, he finds this difficult. Therefore Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase ready-made garments such as jeans, shirts, pants, belts, etc. for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. With the profits expected from this loan, Kousar intends to buy a new refrigerator for food preservation. She is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments such as jeans, shirts, pants, belts, etc.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Mercy is married and works hard to support her seven children by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 1,800 from NWTF to buy a solar lamp so that her children can study at night. The lamp will also save money, help the environment and reduce the number of health risks and hazards facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Aston

texts.en: Aston is a hardworking man with four children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming but he is also a veterinarian. The money he has earned has allowed him to educate his children, and his main goal for the future is to see them graduate so that they can get good jobs. He plans to pay for their continuing education by buying more cows and expanding his farm. His main challenge is customers who fail to pay their bills. Aston will use this loan to buy a heifer and medications for his animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and medications for his cows.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a forty-six-year-old, hard-working lady with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She runs a bar business, which she started with an aim of earning more income.  Like all good mothers she wants to educate her children to higher levels of learning and expand her business to new markets so as to raise more money to support the family.  Stella is requesting for a loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Шухрат добрый и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат и имеет детей. Шухрат занимается выращиванием риса.  С марта по ноябрь он трудиться на рисовом поле. На фотографии он находится на месте деятельности. В этом деле ему также помогает его брат, который имеет большой опыт в выращивании различных сельскохозяйственных культур.  Сам Шухрат занимается этим делом более 7 лет.   В этом году он решил арендовать побольше земли,  чем раньше. Шухрат планирует получит в конце года хороший урожай риса.  Но этот вид деятельности является сезонным, поэтому он также  является водителем маршрутного такси по городу.  
 На полученный  кредит он планирует купить минеральные удобрения и другие химикаты.    Шухрат  будет очень благодарен за поддержку так как от этого зависит его будущий урожай.
texts.en: Shuhrat is a kind and hardworking man.  He is married and has children.  Shuhrat is involved in growing rice.  He works on the rice field from March through November.  The photograph shows him at his place of business.  His brother, who has a lot of experience in growing various agricultural crops, helps him with this business.  Shuhrat has been involved in this business for over 7 years.  This year, he decided to lease more land than before.  Shuhrat plans to get a good rice harvest at the end of the year.  But this type of business is seasonal, and this is why he also drives a shuttle taxi in the city.  He plans to purchase mineral fertilizers and other chemicals with this loan.  Shuhrat will be very grateful for the support because his future harvest depends on it.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and other chemicals

loans.name: Norani Masjid Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 25-year-old, vigorous lady and a mother of three children. For the last 12 years, her husband has owned a business, selling television trollies. He has a good number of clients and he earns enough money to meet the household expenses.  

Allah Rakhi, as a member of a four-person lending group (Norani Masjid Group), has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase the necessary items for her husband's shop.  In this way, her husband would be able to purchase more television trollies for his customers. 

Allah Rakhi is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. 

Note: In the picture, Allah Rakhi is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy television trollies for her husband's business.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 26 years old. She is married and a mother  of one child. She lives in Langub, Calamba.

To make a living, Arceli engages in snack vending. She has been in this business for 2 years, earning a monthly income of 2200 Philippines pesos (PHP).

Arceli is requsting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make a product to sell. Arceli is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2011.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients, such as one sack of flour, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. He has no children and has been doing farming for three years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'transporting my farm produce.' His biggest challenge is 'controlling  pests.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Sammy was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'they support farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'saving money.'

His highest monthly expense is transportation costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Sammy replied, 'he will be able to supply his produce on time.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sammy owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, TV' but does not have 'running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie works hard to support her family. Josie is married and has a native bag-making business in the Philippines.

Josie requested a PHP 60,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional materials for making native bags.

Josie has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making native bags

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and has four children. Marilyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pig.

Marilyn has been pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat is 50 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has five dependent children to take care of. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for thirty years. She complements that income by working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day.

This is the second microloan for Rat with VisionFund. She fully repaid the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Rat wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for home improvement

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Don Miguel tiene 52 años de edad, está casado hace más de 15 años con la Sra. De Las Nieve, tienen 2 hijos mayores, que ya son independientes.
El señor Miguel es hijo de agricultor y toda la vida se dedicó al cultivo de mandioca, maíz, poroto y otros productos agrícolas, pero también se dedica a la venta de artesanía ya que su Sra. es tejedora y él se encarga de  vender las colchas que ellos mismos producen. Lleva los productos artesanales a venderlos por las ciudades de Areguá, Luque. Aparte de eso también se dedica a la venta de tabacos. Gracias a este trabajo logró brindar una modesta casa a su familia y pudo hacerse de varias comodidades en su hogar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, hamacas, sábanas y otros que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes, y lo que le ayudará a tener mas productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is 52 years old and has been married more than 15 years to Sra. De Las Nieve. They have two grown children who are independent.

Sr. Miguel is the son of a farmer, so all of his life has been spent growing cassava, corn, beans, and other agricultural products. He also spends time selling handicrafts since his wife is a weaver. Miguel is in charge of selling the quilts that she produces. He brings these handcrafted products to the cities of Areguá and Luque so that he can sell them. In addition, Miguel sells tobacco. Thanks to his work, he was able to provide a modest house for his family and add a variety of amenities to his home.

Miguel is requesting a loan so that he can buy bedspreads, hammocks, bed sheets, and other seasonal products that are frequently requested by his customers. This will help to supply him with more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, hammocks, bed sheets, and other seasonal products.

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora. María realiza desde hace algún tiempo los créditos a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, le gusta este tipo de créditos ya que le ayudan a crecer en su negocio y a su vez comparte un tiempo con sus amigas y vecinas. Vive por la parroquia de Nabon en Cuenca, lugar que tiene clima frió y está rodeado de exuberante vegetación gracias a su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente aun mantienen vivas sus tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 50 años de edad, es una señora casada y ha concebido 9 hijos, 6 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos estudia en el colegio y dos en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil o jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura y cría animales, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres y ahora es un método para tener ingresos en su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia, también le permite pasar en casa al cuidado de sus seres queridos. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de alimento para sus animales y materiales de construcción, esta repitiendo el crédito para comprar de semillas, abono, cuyes, cerdos y gallinas para continuar creciendo en esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
María has been taking loans alongside her friends and companions of the communal bank Nuevo Bankito la Ramada.  She likes this type of credit for furthering growth in business while spending time with friends and neighbors. 

She lives in the parish of Nabon in Cuenca, a place that has a cold climate and is surrounded by lush vegetation thanks to its rugged terrain. Its architecture is a mix of modern and old and its people maintain their traditions. 

María is 50 years old. She is married with nine children. Six of them are married and live independently, one of them studies at secondary school and two attend a small local school. Her husband works as a mason or laborer. They live in their own house.

María works in agriculture and animal husbandry. She learned from her parents and now it is a way to earn income for the household and to raise the family. It also allows her to spend time at home caring for her loved ones.

The money from her previous loan was invested in animal feed and construction supplies. This loan will be used to buy seed, fertilizer, guinea pigs and chickens in order to continue growing in her financial activity.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura continúa  viviendo  en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella continua con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella también se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de su domicilio solo los días domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Maura requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para continuar preparando  mas platos típicos de la región, ella comprará insumos al por mayor como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. 

Maura continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maura continues to live in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, where does all kinds of activities. She continues to raise small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also sells food as a street vendor in the door of her home, just on Sundays. She has been working in this business for several years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

On this occasion Maura needs the loan to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing more traditional dishes of the region. She will buy supplies at wholesale, such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles and other things. 

Maura continues as a member of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank of the Arariwa Association and is grateful for the opportunity offered through this organization. As well, she promises to make the loan repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: To buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosalvina

texts.es:
Rosalvina nació en la ciudad de Colquepata pero vive en la ciudad de Huancarani, ella tiene 30 años  y tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. 

Rosalvina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

(Las ciudades de Colquepata y Huancarani son distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Rosalvina was born in the city of Colquepata but lives in the city of Huancarani. She is 30 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has 3 children.

Rosalvina is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is raising her family through a lot of effort and dedication as her financial activity is selling clothing. She has been in this business for 10 years and she is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She belongs to the communal bank Mamacha Rosario. At this time she needs a loan in order to buy clothes for children, ladies, and men. She appreciates and values the loan and agrees to comply with the monthly payments.

The cities of Colquepata and Huancarani are districts of the Paucartambo Province in the department of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell in her business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva el nombre de Mujeres  Trabajadoras se encuentra en el 1º. Ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están con muchas ansias de crecer y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Del Rosaria  de 54 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de hamacas y otras Artesanías desde hace ya varios años, trabajo con el cual puede sostener económicamente a su familia, y darles todo lo que necesitan para que no tengan que pasar por ninguna privación como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus hamacas y demás artesanías. Agradecen por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo  ya que les permitirá ir creciendo en el trabajo de cada una.
texts.en:
This group of enterprising women who bear the name "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hard-working Women), is in the first loan cycle of the women's communal bank program. They are very eager to grow and give their families everything they need. 

One of the stories worth highlighting is that of Del Rosaria, who is 54, and has been selling hammocks and other crafts for several years now. Through this work she is able to support her family and give them everything they need, so that they don't have to experience any privations such as those she had to experience. 

She is applying for this loan in order to buy thread, needles, and other supplies so that she can continue making her hammocks and other crafts. She is grateful for the help that she and her friends are receiving, as it will allow each of them to grow in their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar sombreros y  zapatos.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is forty-one years old and a divorced woman. She has five children, and she lives in Kasese, Uganda. She sells cassava flour, and she also has a motorcycle for a transport business. The hired rider of the motorcycle remits to her 80% of the daily earnings from its use. She hopes to expand her business and own a food store in the town center, despite a lack of capital. Jane intends to use this loan to buy more cassava flour to resell.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to resell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously took a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase merchandise items to resell in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise to resell, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. More items to sell will result in better profit for her. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness, and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her grandchildren will have a good education. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise to resell, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
“Sagrada Familia” esta reuniéndose en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una, lo cual arrojo que tres de ellas tienen un ingreso muy escaso.
Ignacia se encuentra en un nivel rojo, es decir con ingreso muy bajo, pero ella es consciente que por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo podrá crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y también mejorar su emprendimiento. Ella se dedica a la lavandería, es decir, lava la prenda de sus clientes, y cuenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado y pesado, pero que está contenta con lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de jabones, suavizantes para ropas y demás insumos que necesite para poder seguir creciendo y tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Sagrada Familia” group is in its first loan cycle in the women's communal bank program. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in order to know the situation of each of them. This indicated that three of them have very limited income.

Ignacia is at the red level; that is to say with very low income, but she is aware that by means of her effort and work she will be able to grow, improve her living conditions, and also improve her business.  She does laundry; that is to say she washes the clothing of her customers. She says that it is very heavy and demanding work, but she is happy with what she does, as it is decent and honest work. 

She is applying for this loan so that she can buy soap, fabric softener, and other supplies she needs to continue growing and have better income with which to help her family.

loans.use: To buy soap, fabric softener, and other supplies.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. Milagros is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a PHP 24,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
This is Rona. She sells shih tzu dogs. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for food and grooming of her dogs. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and to meet her personal, household, and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to pay for food and grooming of her dogs. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rona dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good future. She attends the weekly fellowship group* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for food and grooming of dogs

loans.name: Janneth Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Janneth está realizando su tercer crédito  en el banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada. Vive por la parroquia de Nabon en Cuenca, lugar que tiene clima frió y está rodeado de exuberante vegetación gracias a su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo, su gente aun mantienen vivas sus tradiciones.

La Señora Janneth tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 10 y 8 años y un bebé de 10 meses, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo una buseta, la casa en la que viven es de propia.

Doña Janneth desde que era una niña le enseñaron sus padres a trabajar en la agricultura, ella se dedica a sembrar hortalizas y a cría cuyes, gallinas y ganado, estas actividades le da la oportunidad de pasar en casa y cuidar de sus hijos.
 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de abono, semillas, cuyes y gallinas.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Janneth is taking out her third loan from the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada community bank. She lives in the Nabon parish of Cuenca, a region that has a cold climate and is surrounded with luxuriant vegetation due to its hilly geography. Its architecture is a mix of traditional and modern and its people still keep their traditions alive.

Janneth is 30 years old, she is married and her marriage has produced three children: a 10 year old, an 8 year old and a 10-month-old baby. Her two older children attend a small school in the area. Her husband is a professional driver and works driving a small bus. They own the house that they live in.

Janneth's parents taught her how to work as a farmer when she was a child. She works growing vegetables and raising guinea pigs, chickens and livestock. These activities allow her to go into the house to care for her children.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of fertilizer, seeds, guinea pigs and chickens.

Her dream is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra lives at Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is a 49-year-old, married woman, who has six children. She and her husband are engaged in farming, to support themselves and their children. They cultivate bananas and root crops, and also harvest coconuts for sale. She has been doing this kind of business for many years.

Recently, Alejandra requested a loan from GDMPC. She intends to use the loan to finance the cost of weeding the farm, and to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to see her children successful and have better living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and to pay for weeding of the farm

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 60 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Julita works very hard to provide for her family.

Julita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 28 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, milk, bread, and laundry soap. 

Julita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 60 years old and married, with nine children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks, like coffee, cream, noodles, sugar, and canned goods, to sell in her general store.

Letecia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years. She has also been selling clothes for six years and earns additional income by raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like coffee, cream, noodles, sugar, and canned goods, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Pablina es una persona muy trabajadora, que tiene un pequeño puesto, que es un copetín, hoy cuenta que también tiene una fabrica de ladrillos, y mediante ambos trabajos es que esta pudiendo salir adelante. Ella es destacada por el esfuerzo y sacrificio que hace.
Su anterior crédito lo invirtió en su copetín, para la compra de insumos para vender en su puesto, hoy solicita otro nuevo crédito, pero esta vez para poder invertirlo en su fabrica de ladrillos, ya que quiere comprar arcilla. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Pablina is a very hard-working person who has a small stand selling snacks. Today she says that she also has a brickworks, and through both jobs she is managing to get ahead in life. She stands out because of the effort and self-sacrifice she makes. She invested her previous loan in her snack stand, for the purchase of supplies to sell there.

Today she is applying for a new loan, but this time so that she can invest it in her brickworks, as she needs to purchase clay. She is grateful for this new opportunity she is receiving, as the loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: To buy clay.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 50-year-old, hard-working, married man with nine children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He owns a hotel business which has enabled him to support his family and educate his children. He also deals in agriculture as his side income and has cows. He faces a challenge of increased prices of food products which are a result of weather changes. 

Despite these challenges, his dream is to expand his business into a renowned restaurant in Bundibugyo Town and also to complete his house.

Richard intends to use the loan to buy building materials, such as bricks and cement, to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks and cement, to complete his house.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio es una persona muy trabajadora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio esta saliendo adelante, el y su esposa se ayudan y estan saliendo adelante. Su crédito anterior le ha servido para poder comprar cubiertas para su minibus, y así pudo seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Hoy también tiene un furgón en el cual reparte panificados, y con ello tiene ingresos extras. Solicita de este nuevo crédito para la compra de panificados para la venta, y así seguir creciendo y trabajando.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a hardworking individual who has been able to move forward through effort and sacrifice. His wife helps him and they have been able to get ahead. His previous loan was used to buy covers for his minibus, which allowed him to continue working and providing good service to his customers.

Today, Ignacio also has a van that he uses for delivering baked goods as a way of earning extra income. He is requesting this new loan so that he can buy baked goods to sell, which will allow him to continue growing and working.

loans.use: to buy baked goods to sell.

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
La chicas superpoderosas es llamado el excelente grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo y mediante la unión de esfuerzos entre todas ellas.
Eva es una de estas mujeres, quien es modista, y cuenta que siempre esta llena de trabajo que le piden sus clientes, es muy buena en lo que hace y es por eso que le esta yendo muy bien. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por salir adelante y crecer, ya que quiere ayudar a los suyos a salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus confecciones y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Están contentas por la ayuda que reciben ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
This great group from the town of Caacupé is called Las Chicas Superpoderosas (Superpowerful Women). They are all heads of families who work together to help their families.

Eva is one of these women. She is a dressmaker and says that her order book is always full with requests from her customers. She is very good at what she does and so all is going well. Eva is a very hardworking person who makes a daily effort to get ahead and grow as she wants to help her family to do the same.

Eva is seeking a loan so she can buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons etc. so she can continue making clothing and complete her customers' orders. She and the other women are  grateful for the help provided by the loan.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons and other supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo 7, están capacitándose y mejorando por dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de las integrantes.
Margarita cuenta que hace realiza venta de hortalizas, teniendo su propia producción, ya que tiene una pequeña huerta en la que cosecha las hortalizas. Ella está muy contenta con lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de semillas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo, que les ayudará mucho.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] is in their seventh loan cycle. They are training themselves and making progress in order to give their families everything that they never had. They are completing a poverty elimination survey to determine the status of each of the members.

Margarita has been making her living by selling vegetables. She grows her own produce, since she has a small garden where she cultivates vegetables. She is very happy with what she does because it is a respectable job and above all honest work.

Señora Margarita requests this loan to purchase seeds. This will help her complete her business plan, which will help her improve her income. They appreciate this opportunity they are receiving. It will help them a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds to cultivate vegetables

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger está en unión libre, tiene la edad 45 años y vive con su esposa e hijo. El con el crédito pretende comprar cerdos para el engorde de ellos luego venderlos. El ya ha tenidos de estos animales y le ha ido muy bien con las venta por lo cual quiere comprar más para obtener mejores ganancias. El espera poder tenerlos listos rápido para la venta y aprovechar el buen precio actual. El espera superarse y aumentar ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roger is in a common law marriage. He is 45 years old and he lives with his wife and son. With this loan, he plans to buy pigs to fatten and then sell. He has experience raising these animals and he has done very well with the sale of pigs. That's why he wants to buy more pigs, in order to earn better profits. He hopes to have them ready for sale quickly and take advantage of current good prices. 

He hopes to improve his situation and increase profits for the wellbeing of his family. It is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening

loans.name: Joji

texts.en: Joji is married and a mother of three children. She is 50 years old. She lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. Joji sells dried fish. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns a monthly income of 3,400 PHP. Joji has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase three boxes of dried fish to sell. Joji has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.

loans.use: To purchase three boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Zulfira

texts.ru: Зулфира добрая и отзывчивая женщина в возрасте 32 лет. Она прекрасная жена для своего мужа. Муж тоже любит и ценит её. Пока они не имеют детей, но очень мечтают о них. Живут они в маленьком посёлке. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на проживание Зулфира занимается своим бизнесом. Она дехканка, выращивает картофель, а потом продаёт полученный урожай и получает хороший доход. У неё есть своя площадь земли  для посева картофеля, площадь составляет 1 га. Муж Зулфиры помогает ей в этом деле, когда приходит пора собирать и продавать урожай, он организовывает эту работу. Также для получения дополнительного дохода, они выращивают скот. У них есть несколько голов скота. Зулфира по утрам сама доит корову и продаёт полученное молоко соседям. В данное время Зулфира с мужем хотят увеличить свой доход, так как в ближайшем будущем мечтают о ребёнке и для этого нужно подготовить благоприятные условия в их доме. Поэтому они хотят увеличить объём своего урожая и нуждаются в денежных средствах, чтобы закупить семяна для посева картофеля. Для этого Зулфира обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит для закупа семян. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zulfira is a kind and understanding 32 year-old woman.  She is a beautiful wife for her husband.  Her husband also loves and values her.  While they do not yet have children, they dream of having them.  They live in a small village.  Zulfira is involved in her own business to provide a consistent income for living.  She is a dekhan farmer, who grows potatoes and then sells the harvest and earns a good income.  She has her own land for planting potatoes; the size of the land is 1 hectare.  Zulfira's husband helps her with this business.  When it is time to gather and sell the harvest, he organizes this work.  They also raise livestock to earn additional income.  They have several heads of livestock.  Zulfira milks the cow by herself in the mornings and sells the milk to her neighbors.  At the present time, Zulfira and her husband want to increase their income because they dream of having a child in the near future and need to set up favorable conditions in their home.  This is why they want to increase the volume of their harvest and need money to purchase seeds for planting potatoes.  Zulfira came to Arvand for this purpose and wished to obtain a loan to buy seeds.  She thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting potatoes

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada y actualmente vive solo con su esposo en su casa construida a base de adobe ya que sus hijos son personas mayores e independientes. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, por está razón cultiva cacao, café y otros productos rentables propios de su zona. Posee un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas y media , el cual es su principal sustento económico.Esperanza esta siempre al cuidado de sus plantaciones porque ahí esta el dinero que invierte constantemente. Al llegar a la época de la cosecha recolecta las mazorcas de cacao con ayuda de trabajadores del lugar para luego ser vendido en los diferentes mercados de su localidad.Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar árboles de cacao y reemplazar los árboles desfasados ya que estos no darán ningún tipo de frutos.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old, married, and currently lives alone with her husband in their home built from adobe, as their children are adults and independent. She has farmed from a very young age, raising cacao, coffee and other cash crops of the area. 

She has 2.5 hectares of farmland which is her main financial support. Esperanza is always looking after her plantings, because there is the money that he is constantly investing. When the harvest time arrives she collects the cacao pods with the help of local workers, to later be sold at the various markets in her area.

This is her first Kiva loan, and she feels very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving that is enabling her to move forward. On this occasion, she wishes to borrow 2,000 nuevos soles to buy cacao trees and replace the older trees, as these will no longer produce any kind of fruit.

loans.use: To buy cacao trees.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  6 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  riz  avec  TENEKOURA , premiere personne assise de la gauche vres la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de BOUGOULA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 95.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguignouma II group are all married women. They have an average age of 50, an average of four children each, and all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, a village located in Sanankoroba, the second-largest administrative region in Mali. They all collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and all their previous loans were repaid without incident.

These women work growing rice, and one of the members of the group is Tenekoura. She is the first person seated from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor needed to farm her 1.5 hectares of land. After harvest she sells her produce in a market in the village of Bougoula, and her customers are both resellers and individual consumers.

loans.use: To pay for labor expenses and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
